title: With Eye on Mayors Office, Quinn Turns Her Attention to Income Inequality
description: Christine C. Quinn, confronting an emerging theme among her rivals in the Democratic mayoral primary, proposed an affordable housing plan and a middle-class tax break on Monday, in an acknowledgment that not all New Yorkers have prospered equally under the Bloomberg administration.

title: Battling Jet Lag
description: Ilona De March, who lives in Amsterdam and travels frequently to Atlanta, has a strict rule when she flies across time zones: no alcohol.

title: Stroke Procedure Challenged
description: The usual treatment for ischemic stroke is an intravenous drug that dissolves blood clots, administered within four and a half hours of the first symptoms. In some cases, doctors also thread a wire through an artery in the groin to remove the clot in the brain mechanically and deliver drugs at the site of the clot.

title: Politician Is Pelted With Shoes at Iran Shrine
description: TEHRAN  The speaker of Irans Parliament, an open rival of President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, was pelted with shoes and stones in one of Irans holiest shrines on Sunday, forcing him to cancel a speech there, the semiofficial Iranian Labour News Agency reported Monday.

title: Chagas Disease Costs U.S. More Than Better-Known Illnesses
description: Chagas disease may be obscure, but the economic burden it imposes on the world is greater than that of better-known diseases, like cervical cancer or cholera, according to a new study. Even in the United States, the authors said, the costs of Chagas are commensurate with those of more publicized diseases, like Lyme disease.

title: A Bipartisan Team Tackles Immigration
description: It may take strange bedfellows to pass a broad revamping of the immigration system this year. If so, the Bipartisan Policy Center, a research group in Washington, appears to have assembled some.

title: Tenors Amid the Turmoil of War in the Trenches
description: PHILADELPHIA  You can be a brilliant composer with a strong musical voice yet not be suited to opera, an enticing but unwieldy genre. It usually takes someone a few tries to write an effective work.

title: Georgian Official Accuses President of Provoking Violence
description: TBILISI, Georgia  Three days after protesters brawled with politicians loyal to President Mikheil Saakashvili while he was delivering his annual address to the nation, the countrys interior minister said Monday that Mr. Saakashvili himself had artificially provoked the episode to win the sympathy of Western governments.

title: Rise in Drug Overdose Deaths
description: Drug overdose fatalities in New York City tripled between 1990 and 2006, a new study reports, and most of the increase came from the growing abuse of prescription pain medicines.

description: In the time-honored tradition of ballooning Washington money scandals, details keep emerging about the symbiotic relationship between Senator Robert Menendez and a Florida eye-surgeon and big donor named Dr. Salomon Melgen.

title: Obama Awards Medal of Honor to Former Army Sergeant
description: WASHINGTON  Saluting Clinton Romesha for embodying the soldiers creed of never leaving behind a fallen comrade, President Obama on Monday bestowed the Medal of Honor on him for courageously defending a remote American outpost in eastern Afghanistan from a ferocious attack by more than 300 Taliban fighters.

title: How Advertising Targets Our Children
description: I always wanted somewhat cynical children, at least where advertising and proselytizing are concerned. That is, I wanted my children to grow up alert to the silken, studied salesmanship of those who want your trust but are not really your friends.

title: Fitness May Lower Dementia Risk
description: Being physically fit in midlife is associated with a lower risk of dementia in old age, a new study reports.

description: Thats the headline for an article posted on the Washington Redskins Web site on Monday afternoon, apparently in response to recent criticism.

title: When Dad Is Your Kidnapper
description: Fiction is filled with putatively adorable children, little innocents who describe the world so much more wisely than their elders can. But the 6-year-old Meadow Kennedy, the girl at the center of a kidnapping case in Amity Gaiges Schroder, really is something special. When her father tells Meadow that she has a wonderful way of seeing things, he isnt overselling her wisdom.

title: Senate Democrats Unveil Proposal to Avert Broad Spending Cuts
description: Senate Democratic leaders are closing in on a $120 billion package of tax increases on the affluent and targeted spending cuts that they say would be large enough to put off looming, across-the-board spending cuts to defense and domestic programs for 10 months.

title: Picking Source of Babys Milk
description: When Bevil Conway and his partner brought their premature twins home from the hospital, the two fathers felt it was important to keep them on a diet of breast milk. So the new parents purchased a couple of coolers and an extra freezer, and they started scouring Web sites for mothers with extra milk to share.

title: Reveling in a Russian Composers Breadth and Depth
description: The 81-year-old Russian composer Sofia Gubaidulina has described herself as the place where East meets West. A Christian and the daughter of a Tatar-Russian couple, she is known for often spiritual music that met with resistance from the Soviet authorities, who denounced her alternative tunings as irresponsible. Shostakovich, a fellow aesthetic dissident, supported her detour from the officially sanctioned music paths.

description: IVE spent most of my career in the cosmetics industry, and now, as chief executive of Ahava North America, Im doing many more business trips.

description: PUSHA T

title: Borrowing From the Future
description: EARLY withdrawals from 401(k) and 403(b) retirement accounts can have significant effects on a nest egg. Even borrowing against those accounts can stunt their growth.

title: The 1040 Blues
description: EVEN those who closely followed the numbing, eye-glazing and, at times, frustrating so-called fiscal cliff drama of late December  and people could be forgiven for tuning it out because it coincided with New Years Eve  find themselves trying to figure out the best angles throughthe tax increases wrought by the deal. And if they are not scratching their heads now, wait until April 2014, when they could see a drastic increase in their tax bill.

title: In Pursuit of Taste, en Masse
description: AMERICANS didnt always ask so many questions or expect so much in their quest for enjoyment. It was enough for them simply to savor a good cigar, a nice bottle of wine or a tasty morsel of cheese.

title: The Biggest Financial Asset in Your Portfolio Is You
description: WHAT is probably your most important asset? Stocks? Bonds? Real estate? Collectibles? None of the above. It is human capital.

title: Tech Can Help to Keep Up With the Big Money
description: ONE of the tax-fairness controversies in the presidential campaign last year grew out of the news that 33 of the wealthiest Americans paid little or no income tax in 2009, in part because they probably applied stock market losses to counter capital gains.

title: Divining Which Way the Wind Is Blowing
Roxy Musics Roaring Twenties
description: Roxy Music, the British band that thrived in the 1970s, built its audience  and then lost parts of it  by creating and then quickly confounding expectations. With a lineup that included the guitar, bass and drums standard in rock, as well as the electronica pioneer Brian Eno, and a reed player, Andy Mackay, whose oboe and saxophone lines gave the group a quirkily distinctive sound, Roxy Music often put a futuristic gloss on traditional song forms.

title: The Insidious Language of War
description: It is a clich anymore to note that three decades of war have changed Afghanistan. But sometimes, even the little differences have the power to shock when they are noticed  like the realization of how profoundly war has worked its way into everyday conversations, and has even changed vocabulary.

title: Pollutions Link to Birth Weight
description: Exposure to air pollution during pregnancy raises the odds of having low-birth-weight babies, a large international study has found.

title: Cold Blood, Hot Blood
description: Q. Does taking a blood thinner make a person feel colder? Does blood thin when people move to a warm climate, making them feel colder if they move back north?

title: ABC Gets First TV Interview With Amanda Knox
description: Years of jostling among television networks for the first on-camera interview of Amanda Knox ended on Monday with ABC emerging as the victor.

title: How High Should You Be on High-Dividend Stocks?
description: STOCKS have made investors money for four years, but they have also made them nervous. Bonds have been a profitable alternative, but prices are so high that there could be risk in this presumed haven, and in any case yields are near record lows.

title: Dont Worry, Its Just Part of a Communist Plot
description: Dont mind the fireballs in Queens and Brooklyn  theyre all part of the show.

title: Navigating Between Tax Avoidance and Evasion
description: MOST people think they pay too much in taxes and will do their best to avoid them, but few take that a step further into illegal tax evasion.

title: Mark McNairy New Amsterdam: Fall 2013 RTW

title: Heading for Retirement on Autopilot
description: JANE DOE never noticed as hundreds of dollars disappeared from her paychecks since she was hired two years ago.

title: Squeezing Frequent Fliers Is a Likely Merger Outcome
description: WHAT about my miles?

title: An Artist Finds a Dignified Ending for an Ugly Story
description: Her own husband called her a bear woman. An 1854 advertisement in The New York Times said she was the link between mankind and the ourang-outang. She became known in the popular imagination during the mid-19th century as the ugliest woman in the world. After she died from complications of childbirth, her body and the body of her baby appeared for decades in freak exhibitions throughout Europe.

title: Perhaps Her Mom Was Named Tippi
description: Over the last few months, Alfred Hitchcocks reputation has endured a beating: The Girl and Hitchcock made him out to be unlikable, imperious, a sexual predator. Now, in what is intended to be theatrical homage, comes further damage. Enough is enough.

title: Holiday Parking
description: Because of Lincolns Birthday, alternate-side parking regulations in

title: Zen Groups Distressed by Accusations Against Teacher
description: Since arriving in Los Angeles from Japan in 1962, the Buddhist teacher Joshu Sasaki, who is 105 years old, has taught thousands of Americans at his two Zen centers in the area and one in New Mexico. He has influenced thousands more enlightenment seekers through a chain of some 30 affiliated Zen centers from the Puget Sound to Princeton to Berlin. And he is known as a Buddhist teacher of Leonard Cohen, the poet and songwriter.

title: Slower Growth of Health Costs Eases Budget Deficit
description: WASHINGTON  A sharp and surprisingly persistent slowdown in the growth of health care costs is helping to narrow the federal deficit, leaving budget experts trying to figure out whether the trend will last and how much the slower growth could help alleviate the countrys long-term fiscal problems.

title: Reality Show Cast Member Who Died in Crash Was Special Forces Veteran
description: 8:00 p.m. | Updated The reality television show cast member who died in a helicopter crash in Southern California on Sunday was an Army Special Forces veteran who had served four tours of duty in Iraq, family members said Monday.

title: Warming Effect of Urban Activities Felt Widely
description: You dont have to live in a city  or even near one  for urban activities to affect your weather, according to a new study.

title: A Mega-Prime Number, Sensitive Salmon and More
description: My scurrying ancestor.

title: Gender Gap Widens
description: To the Editor:

title: Fears of the Future Haunt a Budding Generation of Afghan Strivers
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The landmarks of this capital citys new middle class light up a once-restrained night sky  vast and glittering wedding halls with aspirational names like Kabul-Paris, streetlamp networks, come-hither billboards for energy drinks.

title: Off the Runway: Day 5
description: Scene from the fifth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: A Match Made in the Code
description: New Orleans  In the quest to find true love, is filling out a questionnaire on a Web site any more scientific than praying to St. Valentine?

title: Univision and Disney Give Details of Fusion, a Channel for Latinos
description: A new 24-hour news and entertainment channel has a name, Fusion. It also has powerful backers in Univision and ABC News, a unit of the Walt Disney Company, and distribution deals in at least 20 million homes. What is not known is whether Fusion has an audience.

title: The Daily Do | Carolina Herrera
description: The feminine Victory Roll up-do at Carolina Herrera somehow felt both 1940s and fresh. The unexpected center part only added to its nostalgic romance.

title: Making Sure That a Kilo Is Always a Kilo
description: A pint may be a pound the world around, but a kilogram is one kilogram only if it is the same weight as a 134-year-old cylinder of platinum-iridium alloy that sits in a vault at the International Bureau of Weights and Measures in Svres, near Paris.

title: Environmental Groups Leverage Iowa 2016 Against Cuomo
description: Increasingly, for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York, all politics are national.

title: Nothing Is Sacred
description: Why didnt he break the news on Twitter? That was what much of the Twittersphere was wondering Monday morning after Pope Benedict XVI  with 1.5 million followers despite being on Twitter for less than a month, and with only 34 tweets to his account  announced he was stepping down at the end of the month. (The popes last tweet, on Sunday, gave no hint of the news to come.) Reaction was mixed, with some expressing sadness at his relatively short reign and others seeming grateful to see the back of him. And then there was the fashion publicist grateful that none of her clients was showing on Monday.

title: Speakers With a Big Sound for Big Desks
description: The British loudspeaker maker KEF, a name well known to audiophiles, has broken out both the high-tech and marketing razzle-dazzle for its desktop X300A speakers.

title: Group Seeks to Jump-Start Ocean Protections
description: A group of prominent officials from several nations are creating an independent body dedicated to making environmental protection a top priority in global policymaking involving the high seas.

title: Waste Is Seen in Program to Give Internet Access to Rural U.S.
description: AGATE, Colo.  The bank is gone from this once-thriving ranching and farming community on Colorados windblown eastern plain, as are the dairies, the hotel and the Union Pacific depot. The post office remains, at the corner of Main Street and First Avenue, the intersection of the towns two paved streets.

title: Executive Director of High Line Group to Step Down
description: Robert Hammond, who led the effort to save an abandoned elevated railway in the heart of Chelsea and turn it into a new kind of park, announced on Monday night that he would step down as executive director of Friends of the High Line by the end of the year.

title: Liverpool Red-Faced
description: Luis Surez took a dive and Liverpool was left gasping for air.

title: Senate Votes Against Stripping Tribal Land Provision From Domestic Violence Measure
description: The Senate on Monday evening turned back a Republican effort to strip from the reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act a controversial provision that would expand the authority of Native American courts to prosecute non-Indians accused of abusing native women, but senators left final passage of the bill until Tuesday.

title: S.E.C. Nominee Discloses Law Firm Wealth
description: It is no secret that the partners at the white-shoe law firms Debevoise & Plimpton and Cravath, Swaine & Moore earn a decent living. The financial disclosure form of Mary Jo White, the Obama administrations pick to become the next chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, reveals just how decent.

title: A Tribute to the Pope, and It Goes Well With Milk
description: When Anthony Artuso heard the news of Pope Benedict XVIs resignation plans on Monday, what else could he do but order up a batch of pope cookies.

title: G.O.P. Chief in Florida Pleads Guilty
description: MIAMI  Averting a prolonged and heated political drama, Jim Greer, a former chairman of the Republican Party of Florida, walked into an Orlando courtroom on Monday and pleaded guilty to grand theft and money laundering charges.

title: The Naked Bird, Illustrated
description: In The Unfeathered Bird, Katrina van Grouw pulls back feather, skin and muscle to reveal beauty in avian form, evolution and function.

title: Using Silly Cat Videos to Sell Litter-Box Products
description: WATCHING cat videos is so popular that it has become shorthand for being unproductive, whether or not someone being distracted by the Internet is actually watching a cat riding a robotic vacuum or playing the piano.

title: Flights of Winged Majesty
description: In the acknowledgments to her unsettling and irresistible book, The Unfeathered Bird, Katrina van Grouw pauses in her listing of names to say, I must assure readers that no birds were harmed during the making of this book.

title: Where the Singles Are: A Dating Guide by ZIP Code
description: At Trulia, a residential real estate Web site, the analysts are constantly crunching data  home and apartment listings, prices, school ratings, crime rates and other numbers.

title: Longer Spans Without Serious Airline Accidents
description: The last commercial airline accident that resulted in deaths of passengers was four years ago, the longest such span for decades. And the previous span between accidents was the longest before now.

title: Gun-Friendly New Mexico Considers Stricter Controls
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  As state lawmakers around the country wrestle with whether to tighten gun laws, the fierce debate has not always fallen neatly along party lines  especially in the West.

title: Some Fresh Ideas, and Wearable Ones
description: Each time I worm my way through the mob inside the tent at Lincoln Center, I tell myself: these are not fashion people. But Im wrong. They are fashion, just as American Express, Coke and Fiber One are fashion. Everybody wants the love.

title: Syrian Insurgents Claim to Control Large Hydropower Dam
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian insurgents and opposition activists said Monday that rebel forces had taken control of Syrias largest hydroelectric dam, an assertion that, if confirmed, would give them significant control over a vital reservoir and what remains of the sporadic power supplies in their war-ravaged country.

title: Ankle Injuries to Sideline Williams for Two Games
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The struggling Nets announced Monday that their star point guard, Deron Williams, will miss the final two games before the All-Star break because of inflammation in both ankles.

title: Russia: Explosion in Coal Mine Kills at Least 17
description: An explosion in a coal mine in northern Russia killed at least 17 miners in a shaft saturated with methane gas, rescue workers said Monday. The blast occurred about 2,500 feet underground near the city of Vorkuta. Rescue workers said 23 people had been in the shaft at the time. Officials blamed a buildup of methane gas, a common peril in coal mines, for the explosion. Rescue workers said that two miners had escaped on their own and that three others had been rescued. They recovered 17 bodies and were still trying to find one miner, the Interfax news agency reported.

title: Novak Is Knicks Barometer Off the Bench
description: While the Knicks have a spectacular scorer (Carmelo Anthony) and a herculean rebounder/inside defender (Tyson Chandler), Coach Mike Woodson recognizes that significant bench contribution from players like Amare Stoudemire, J. R. Smith and Steve Novak is critical if the Knicks are to continue to challenge the Miami Heat for supremacy in the Eastern Conference.

title: Mainlander Shoppers Met With Protests in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONGThere is little to distinguish Sheung Shui from the many suburbs studded with high-rises and elevated walkways that dot the northern parts of Hong Kong, except for one thing: It is the first stop on the local train link that comes in from the nearby border with mainland China.

title: Gaza: Palestinians Begin Voter Registration Campaign
description: Palestinian officials on Monday began updating voter registration records in the Gaza Strip, a critical step toward ending the rift between the Fatah Party, which governs in the West Bank, and the militant Hamas movement, which controls Gaza. The Central Elections Commission, based in the West Bank, opened 257 centers throughout the Gaza Strip and will try to get 300,000 residents to update their electoral information. It was the first time that Hamas had allowed the commission to operate in Gaza since 2007. President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority, the leader of Fatah, has said that voter registration is a critical precursor to elections that could unite the rival factions, but the broader reconciliation process appears stalled. Over the weekend at meetings hosted by Egypt, the Palestinian rivals failed to make progress on timetables for forming a new government and holding elections.

title: The Daily Shoe | Belstaff
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: North Korea Draws New China Scrutiny
description: BEIJING  The Chinese governments approach to North Korea appears to be the subject of heightened debate ignited by the Norths plans to proceed with a nuclear test, Chinese and American experts say.

title: A Database of Names and How They Connect
description: It sounds like a Rolodex for the 1 percent: two million deal makers, power brokers and business executives  not only their names, but in many cases the names of their spouses and children and associates, their political donations, their charity work and more  all at a bankers fingertips.

title: As Numbers Add Up, Rutgers Coach Has Renewed Sense of Urgency
description: In 1990, when C. Vivian Stringer was coaching at Iowa, she received in the mail what she described as a gold letter with a diamond on it from the university congratulating her for her 300th win.

title: Candidates in Kenyas First Presidential Debate Condemn Ethnic Politics
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  With a hotly contested, anxiously awaited presidential election only three weeks away, Kenya tried something new on Monday night: it held a debate.

title: Airline Industry at Its Safest Since the Dawn of the Jet Age
description: Flying on a commercial jetliner has never been safer.

title: Maryland: Brief Delay in Terrorism Case
description: The military tribunal case against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four others who are accused of being accomplices in the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks was delayed on Monday as defense lawyers pressed forward with concerns that their confidential communications with their clients and other counsel might be subject to eavesdropping by the government. The chief prosecutor, Brig. Gen. Mark S. Martins of the Army, has said unequivocally that no government entity is monitoring lawyer-client communications, and the judge, Col. James L. Pohl of the Army, expressed skepticism about the defenses fears. But Colonel Pohl agreed to postpone a scheduled hearing on pretrial motions for a day so the defense lawyers could finish interviews with audio technology officials, who will be called as soon as Tuesday to testify about the systems at the military prison and the courtroom at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. The court proceedings are being transmitted via closed circuit to Fort Meade and other locations.

title: Thom Brownes Passion Play
description: Capitalizing on his Michelle Obama inaugural moment, Thom Browne grabbed the spotlight on Monday evening with a grand, jaw-dropping collection that was so ambitious in scale it seemed to be his bid for entre into the pantheon of great designers.

title: 3.1 Phillip Lim: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Bills of the Rich and Famous
description: The bill is named for Steven Tyler of Aerosmith and formerly of American Idol. Mick Fleetwood, Tommy Lee of Mtley Cre, Margaret Cho, Britney Spears, Avril Lavigne and the Osbournes have lobbied for it. So has Neil Diamond. How bad could it be?

title: Partners of Gays in Service Are Granted Some Benefits
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon on Monday expanded benefits to same-sex partners of military personnel to include a range of services offered at various posts and bases, but it withheld more expansive benefits sought by gay and lesbian couples  in particular medical and dental coverage and housing allowances.

title: For Two Senators, Petty Politics Comes First
description: Individual senators hold an enormous amount of power in Washington, which is exactly the way they like it. But when that power is abused, as two Republicans are now doing in trying to derail the nomination of a defense secretary, it has to be curtailed.

title: TV Show Mirrors a Japanese Battery Makers Bind
description: TOKYO  For many viewers in Japan, the plot of the television series Made in Japan was all too real: a struggling manufacturer, Takumi Electronics, turns to advanced lithium-ion batteries to reverse its ailing fortunes.

title: Shell Vessels Sidelined, Imperiling Arctic Plans
description: HOUSTON  In another blow to its Alaskan Arctic drilling program, Royal Dutch Shell said on Monday that it had decided to tow its two drill vessels there to Asian ports for major repairs, jeopardizing its plans to begin drilling for oil in the icy northern seas next summer.

title: Thom Browne: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: The Humble Pope
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass.

title: Reward Spurs Many Tips on Ex-Officer
description: LOS ANGELES  The authorities here have received more than 700 tips from the public on the whereabouts of Christopher J. Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer wanted in connection with three killings, police officials said on Monday.

title: Academic Freedom Vindicated in Brooklyn
description: Debates about academic freedom almost always begin in confusion and end in confusion, but the recent controversy at Brooklyn College is a welcome exception to that rule. When the dust settled, the right thing had happened, the right things had been said, and the wrong things had been repudiated.

title: The Change Upon Christs Rock
description: BENEDICT XVIs resignation might be the most unexpected papal decision since the convening of the Second Vatican Council in the early 1960s  which came about, Pope John XXIII said, not after long deliberation, but like the flower of an unexpected spring.

title: The Pope Could Still Right the Wrongs
description: DURING his eight years as pope, Benedict XVI sought rebirth for the Roman Catholic Church by meeting with victims of predator priests and making several apologies for the churchs aching abuse crisis.

title: Farewell to an Uninspiring Pope
description: POPE BENEDICT XVI quit. Good. He was utterly bereft of charm, tone-deaf and a protector of priests who abused children. Hed been a member of the Hitler Youth. In addition to this woeful rsum, he had no use for women.

title: For Husband of Woman Killed in Turkey, a Grim and Uncertain Odyssey
description: For six desperate days, Steven D. Sierra crisscrossed the city of Istanbul, by foot and by car, in trains and on ferries, in search of his missing wife, a 33-year-old Staten Island woman who had never before been overseas.

title: Carpe Diem Nation
description: Europeans who settled America gave their lives a slingshot shape. They pulled back so they could shoot forward. They volunteered to live in harsh conditions today so their descendants could live well for centuries. The pioneers who traveled West did the same thing. So has each generation of immigrants  sacrificing the present for the sake of the future.

title: Chicago Mayor Seeks More Prison Time for Gun Crimes
description: CHICAGO  On a day when the authorities here filed murder charges in a case that had come to represent the painful price of gun violence, Mayor Rahm Emanuel on Monday called on state lawmakers to increase minimum sentences for gun crimes in Illinois and require violators to serve the bulk of those prison sentences.

title: A Spritz of Power
description: Its kind of amazing, given our politicians obsession with self-promotion, that we havent yet seen a line of Congressional colognes.

title: Finding the Next Champion
description: More than 2,700 dogs are competing at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show, the largest entry in 15 years. The best of show will be announced Tuesday.

title: Zero + Maria Cornejo: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Zhuang Zedong, Skilled in China Foreign Relations and Ping-Pong, Dies at 72
description: In 1971, at the world table tennis championships in Japan, an American player mistakenly boarded a bus carrying the Chinese team. The team had been told not to talk to Westerners, and an awkward silence descended. Ten minutes elapsed. Then the best player in China stood, greeted the American and offered him a gift, a scarf.

title: At Texas Service, Mourners Remember Slain Ex-Sniper as Warrior and Family Man
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Military leaders, law enforcement officials and thousands of others gathered at Cowboys Stadium here on Monday to remember Chris Kyle, the retired Navy SEAL sniper and author who was killed with another man, investigators say, by a troubled veteran he was trying to help.

title: A Turbulent Tenure for a Quiet Scholar
description: When Benedict XVI became pope eight years ago at the age of 78, many Roman Catholic scholars predicted that he would be a caretaker. He would keep the ship sailing in the same direction as his beloved predecessor, John Paul II. And as the rare theologian who knew how to write for a broad audience, Benedict would keep the crew inspired and the sails billowing.

title: Modernize Registration and Require Early Voting Periods
description: President Obama has a long agenda for his State of the Union address, but it is important that he not forget the most fundamental democratic reform of all: repairing a broken election system that caused hundreds of thousands of people to stand in line for hours to vote last year. It is time to make good on his election-night promise.

title: Move New York Citys Primaries to June
description: It should come as no surprise to New York City residents who endured the chaos at local polling places last year that the mayoral contest this year could also be a nightmare. As before, the problem is the citys hopelessly dysfunctional Board of Elections, which says that it will not be able to manage a likely runoff vote in the time required by law. The State Legislature can fix the problem, but only if it moves quickly.

title: New York Mayor Lauds Companies for Cutting Salt Content
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, in the midst of a long-running campaign to change the eating habits of New Yorkers and consumers across the country, declared a victory against salt on Monday, as 21 companies, from Kraft and Goya to FreshDirect, said they had met the first stage in reductions in salt content in foods.

title: Keeping Their Dogs From Looking Like Ours
description: It was a difficult morning for Rudy, a 90-pound Old English sheepdog, who woke up at 6 a.m. Eastern on Monday to prepare for a 1:30 p.m. competition at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | 3.1 Phillip Lim
description: This season, we wanted to bring reality to the runway and create a look thats effortlessbut with an edge, notes Francelle Daly, the lead artist at the 3.1 Phillip Lim show. To achieve a natural yet luminous complexion, she applied foundation to the face using her fingers, so that it emulates the look of real skin; swept a camel-hued shadow onto the eyelids to add depth; and blended a touch of highlighter over the cheeks, along the bridge of the nose, and on the Cupids bow of the lips. Now for the downtown-cool element: Daly saturated the entire lip with a coppery pencil, then went over it with a dark chocolate brown pencil. Layering a brown tone on top of your lip color is a great way to take any shade a bit deeper, she says.

title: Former Deputy Mayor of Newark Is Sentenced
description: A former deputy to Mayor Cory A. Booker of Newark was sentenced Monday to a year and a day in prison for conspiring to commit extortion.

title: Ruling Islamists, Under Attack, Reject Blame for Tunisias Woes
description: TUNIS  Facing public anger and internal divisions after the assassination of an opposition leader, Tunisias largest Islamist party, which leads a governing coalition, blamed the news media, secular elites and the remnants of the old government for its troubles.

title: Watching Obama for Signs of Change
description: WASHINGTON  On Tuesday night, the president will address the nation and Congress on the state of the union. But many will watch as well for signs of the state of Barack Obama.

title: Lottery Numbers
The Die Hard Quandary
description: Later this week, the fifth installment of the Die Hard movies is scheduled to open in theaters across the country. A Good Day to Die Hard stars, once again, Bruce Willis as John McClane, a too-stubborn-for-his-own-good cop who has to stop a highly trained army of bad guys out to wreak destruction and death. It will undoubtedly be a giant hit for Rupert Murdochs News Corporation, the owner of the Die Hard franchise.

title: The Catholic Church Shifted Southward Over the Past Century
description: In 1900, two-thirds of the worlds Catholics lived in Europe. Today, only 20 percent do.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, Feb. 12, 2013
description: In todays world, subject to so many rapid changes and shaken by questions of deep relevance for the life of faith, in order to govern the bark of St. Peter and proclaim the gospel, both strength of mind and body are necessary, strength which in the last few months has deteriorated in me to the extent that I have had to recognize my incapacity to adequately fulfill the ministry entrusted to me.

title: Questions for Jack Lew's Confirmation Hearings
Cuomos Flood Zone Plan

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: How the Unions State Got So Strong
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is likely to declare on Tuesday evening that the state of the union is strong. That word, strong, has become a ritual element of the annual address to Congress, intoned by Mr. Obama and his predecessors over the last 30 years even when things were not going that well.

title: Sacramento Seeks Investors in Battle for N.B.A. Team
description: SACRAMENTO  Its being billed as a battle of the whales here in the state capital, an increasingly fierce contest pitting billionaire against billionaire. The prize is not Californias governorship or the fate of some ballot proposal, but ownership of the N.B.A.s most troubled franchise, the Sacramento Kings.

title: Militant Threats Test Role of a Pentagon Command in Africa
description: NIAMEY, Niger  Created five years ago to focus on training the armed forces of dozens of African nations and strengthening social, political and economic programs, the Pentagons Africa Command now finds itself on a more urgent mission: confronting a new generation of Islamist militants who are testing the United States resolve to fight terrorism without being drawn into a major conflict.

title: Snowbound Residents Improvise Their Escape
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  Savoy Street was still buried under more than 30 inches of snow on Monday. The word was it would stay that way until Friday or later. So what the city could not do, one man in a white Dodge pickup did on his own.

title: A Housing Dispute, Generations Old
description: Race, class and real estate make for a predictably combustible combination in Luck of the Irish, a thoughtful but diffuse new play by Kirsten Greenidge that opened on Monday night at the Claire Tow Theater at Lincoln Center. The plot turns on the disputed ownership of a handsome house in a Boston suburb that has been home to an African-American family, the Taylors, since the late 1950s. A half-century later the descendants of the Taylors make the unhappy discovery that the title may never have been properly transferred from the white couple who bought it on behalf of their grandparents, seeking to sidestep the prevalent racism of the time, which kept such neighborhoods strictly segregated.

title: Call On Me
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Welcome back to Monday. Not that there is anything wrong with that. Truth be told, I dont see much difference between the perception of what makes a Monday puzzle and what makes a Tuesday puzzle. They are so similar that when I solve a Tuesday that is relatively easy, with a nice, well-constructed theme set and good fill, Im satisfied. The tricks and misdirection are for later in the week.

title: Corrections: February 12, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Jeter Fields Grounders and Questions
description: TAMPA, Fla.  At the Yankees minor league complex, compassion and graciousness can be indistinguishable.

title: Brooklyn Man Convicted of Killing Police Officer
description: A Brooklyn man who shot and killed a New York City police officer during a botched drug robbery was convicted of second-degree murder on Monday but acquitted of the most serious murder charge, suggesting that jurors had doubts about whether he intentionally killed the officer.

title: North Korea Promises to Test More Rockets
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The Politburo of North Koreas ruling Workers Party has called for the continued testing of long-range rockets despite the condemnation of previous tests by the United Nations Security Council, the countrys official media reported Tuesday.

title: At Cablevision, Norma Raes Been Escorted Outside
description: Cablevision takes pride in its open-door policy for employees.

title: Changing Catholic Attitudes
description: How attitudes of Catholics about the death penalty, abortion and homosexuality have changed over the years.

title: Wes Gordon: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Struggling Nets Get Big Win Without Williams
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Ninety minutes before his team was to play the Indiana Pacers, Nets General Manager Billy King met members of the New York news media in front of his teams bench to address the state of his reeling team.

title: Marc by Marc Jacobs: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Menopause, the Movie
description: When I was in fifth grade, my Girl Scout troop watched an educational film entitled Becoming a Woman.  Its purpose was to prepare us for the onset of puberty. Of course, it did no such thing. We filed out of the auditorium with a little pink pamphlet published by Modess and a sample box of sanitary napkins with no more of an understanding of our reproductive organs than if we had spent the last half-hour weaving pot holders. Modess because  Because what? I distinctly remember going home and asking my mother why women bleed. I dont know, she said, mixing ground chuck, bread crumbs and egg yolk with her bare hands, Ill have to ask your father.

title: Showing Off Their Manners on the Big Stage
description: In its 137 years, the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show has been held at all four versions of Madison Square Garden. This year, though, the show was held for the first time at the newly renovated Garden, which included a reconfigured upper bowl but less space for the more than 2,700 entrants.

title: North Korea Confirms It Conducted 3rd Nuclear Test
description: WASHINGTON  North Korea confirmed on Tuesday that it had conducted its third, long-threatened nuclear test, according to the official KCNA news service, posing a new challenge for the Obama administration in its effort to keep the country from becoming a full-fledged nuclear power.

title: An Unproven Outfield, at Least for Now
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets outfield has been portrayed as one of baseballs worst, the bleakest component of a wholly uninspiring team.

title: Word of the Day | amicable
description: amicable \a-mi-k-bl\ adjective

title: What Caused the Fatal Stampede at Allahabad Station?
description: More than a day after a stampede that killed three dozen pilgrims and injured nearly 40 at the Allahabad railway station, government officials have not provided any concrete answers about the cause of the accident.

title: Timeline on North Koreas Nuclear Program
description: The countrys nuclear weapons program and its development of long-range rocket systems have angered many in the West, including in the United States.

title: At Marc by Marc Jacobs, a Modern Take on the 70s
description: Youll have to wait a few days more to see the big Marc Jacobs runway show, since the designer, citing delays in getting fabrics and accessories through customs, decided to switch positions on the calendar this season. It has been a weird season for designers, dealing with snow over the weekend and now a rainy Monday, but things at least are moving along. Mr. Jacobs will show his signature collection on Thursday night, and in his regular time slot on Monday night, he showed his younger-skewing collection, Marc by Marc Jacobs, instead.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 9 P.M. (ABC, Bloomberg, CBS, CNBC, CNN, C-Span, Fox, Fox Business, Fox News, MSNBC, NBC, 11, 13, 49) STATE OF THE UNION President Obama is expected to focus on restoring prosperity to the middle class and will unveil initiatives in education, infrastructure, clean energy and manufacturing, according to White House officials. He will also try to summon support for the passage of stricter gun laws and an overhaul of immigration policy. And he will confront the looming battle with Congress over his call to lower the deficit by cutting spending on Medicare, stabilizing Social Security and revamping the tax code.

title: In China, Shock and Acceptance Over Popes Resignation
description: BEIJING  In China, where official relations with the Vatican are a never-ending crisis, as the Vatican Insider put it recently, the news of the resignation of Pope Benedict has been slow to spread. The Chinese state doesnt recognize the Pope as the leader of Chinas Catholics and has had its own patriotic church since the Communist Revolution in 1949.

title: News Quiz | February 12, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: IHT Quick Read: Feb. 12
description: NEWS North Korea appeared to conduct its third, and probably largest, nuclear test on Tuesday, according to American and Asian officials, posing a new challenge for the Obama administration in its effort to keep the country from becoming a full-fledged nuclear power. David E. Sanger reports from Washington, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul.

title: After North Korean Nuclear Test, China Must Deal  With Its Wayward Ally
description: BEIJING  In the aftermath of Tuesdays nuclear test by North Korea, China will almost certainly join the United States in supporting tougher sanctions at the United Nations, accompanied by sterner reprimands from Beijing against its recalcitrant ally in Pyongyang.

title: China Looms Over Response to Nuclear Test by North Korea
description: UNITED NATIONS  At the United Nations, the desire to impose ever harsher sanctions on North Korea to try to curb its development of nuclear arms and ballistic missiles has long stalled in the face of Chinese opposition  the standard chain of events playing out here again on Tuesday after North Korea said it had carried out its third nuclear test.

title: Report Faults Priorities in Studying Breast Cancer
description: Too little of the money the federal government spends on breast cancer research goes toward finding environmental causes of the disease and ways to prevent it, according to a new report from a group of scientists, government officials and patient advocates established by Congress to examine the research.

title: Heavenly Oasis
description: There has never been a shortage of sybaritic pleasures in Marrakesh, but until recently spas were not among them. It was just the local hammams, says Sandra Zwollo, a Dutch expat who founded the womens-only spa retreat Harem in 2011. But now that the Royal Mansour has set a new standard for ultraluxe pampering, every hotel is following suit. The Taj Palace  which served as the backdrop for Carrie and companys escapades in Sex and the City 2  will soon open its 20,000-square-foot space with a pond-size green marble pool, twin hammams and traditional ayurvedic treatments. The Arabian Night aesthetic continues at Palais Namaskar, a 12-acre playground dotted with reflecting pools, orange-scented yoga gardens and a hammam that comes with a private steam room and its own fireplace. The spa at the Selman  a sprawling resort with a Jacques Garcia-designed hotel  complements the mellow Moroccan interiors (bronze lanterns, tadelakt walls) with a serious European health regimen by the French diet guru Henri Chenot. And at the new Delano Marrakech  the hotels first outpost outside South Beach  the 6,500-square-foot Pearl Spa is mosaic-tile fantasia offering services ranging from algae body wraps to ultrasound fat reduction.

title: Lost and Found at the Kumbh Mela
description: ALLAHABAD, Uttar Pradesh Most people know the heart-sinking feeling of losing someone in a crowded place. Imagine the feeling of being lost at the largest gathering of humanity in the world, the Kumbh Mela.

title: Test Yourself | English, Feb. 12, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the Opinion piece The Secret to Fixing Bad Schools.

title: Chief of Italian Aerospace Company Held in Inquiry
description: PARIS  Italy awoke Tuesday to yet another corporate scandal with political overtones, as prosecutors in Milan arrested the head of the state-controlled aerospace company Finmeccanica in an investigation related to the sale of 12 helicopters to India in 2010.

title: Pope Benedict XVI Announces He Will Resign
description: In Frail Pope Breaks Tradition and Resigns, Rachel Donadio reports news that shocked Roman Catholics on Monday. Use this article, the video above, and the linked articles, below, to answer the following questions.

title: Do Illegal Immigrants Actually Hurt the U.S. Economy?
description: Earlier this month I met Pedro Chan at his small apartment above an evangelical church in Brooklyns Sunset Park neighborhood. Chan, who shares the place with three others, is short and muscular. He has a quiet voice and a patient demeanor that seems to have served him well on his journey to New York. In 2002, he left his Guatemalan village for a long trip through Mexico and, with the help of a smuggler, across the Texas border. In 2004, he made it to Brooklyn, where his uncle helped him find work on small construction crews.

title: Picturing the End of Analog
description: I grew up in the Bronx, but Ive never had any dewy-eyed nostalgia for the days of stickball and egg creams. My early life on the urban mainland in the 1960s was marked by rapid, hectic and at times heartbreaking change and loss.

title: What Are Your Predictions for and Reactions to the State of the Union Address?
description: On Tuesday night, President Obama will deliver his first State of the Union address for his second term in office.

title: To Kick A Ball Down the Field
description: JERUSALEM  Ten minutes before the end of the game the 19-year-old Gabriel Kadiev entered the field at Teddy Stadium. When he kicked the ball, screams rose from the bleachers  cheers of support from some quarters, of disapproval from others. Kadiev is no soccer star, but as a Chechen and a Muslim, he has become the accidental hero of an Israeli drama.

title: Lively Online Reactions in China to Nuclear Test
description: BEIJING  As the world grapples with the news that North Korea has conducted a nuclear test, what is the reaction here in China, often considered North Koreas one true friend, the ally that was as close as lips and teeth?

description: By announcing the detonation of a nuclear device, Kim Jong-un, the young leader of North Korea, seemed to be attempting to raise his status as a worthy leader at home and as a foe to be taken seriously among the countries his government considers its enemies.

title: The Growing Corporate Cash Hoard
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: On TV, New Voice for Champions League

title: Peace Process
description: Even before its release this month, The Gatekeepers was buzzing with critical acclaim and won an Oscar nomination for its concise and unflinching examination of 45 years of Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The documentary, by the Israeli director Dror Moreh, consists of interviews with six former heads of the Israeli internal security service, Shin Bet, whose astonishingly frank, sometimes harrowing testimonies reveal untold truths about events like the Kav 300 affair and the assassination of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin, as well as their own moral conflict  and mounting frustration  over their governments position. Regardless of their political views, Moreh said of his subjects, they all agree its time to put an end to the occupation. Enough! For the director, the films Israeli release holds even greater significance than the Oscar nod; he wishes it could change public opinion in his country. He has reason to be optimistic. After a screening at the Jerusalem Film Festival last summer, Moreh says a few Israeli settlers confessed to him that for the first time they were thinking about the political consequences of where they chose to live.

title: Iran Is Said to Convert Enriched Uranium to Reactor Fuel
description: PARIS  As it prepares for two sets of negotiations with outsiders on its disputed nuclear program, Iran said on Tuesday that it was converting some of its enriched uranium into reactor fuel, the state news agency IRNA reported, potentially limiting the expansion of stockpiles that the West fears could be used for weapons.

title: Why I Finally Decided to Make a Budget
description: I read Ami Kassars recent post on sloppy bookkeeping with interest because I spent so many years struggling to figure out why I was always running out of money.

The aim of the grant program is to extend high-speed Internet access to parts of the country that had little or none of it because private companies said it was too expensive to build.

title: A New Strategy at Barclays
description: The British bank Barclays announced a restructuring of its operations on Tuesday, saying it would eliminate an additional 3,700 jobs, and reported a loss for the fourth quarter of 2012. In an effort to reduce its exposure to risky trading, Barclays said it would reduce the work force in its investment banking division by about 8 percent, or 1,800 jobs, this year, after already cutting 1,600 jobs from the unit. The bank is also cutting 1,900 jobs from its European retail and business banking unit, bringing the total expected layoffs to around 3 percent of the firms global work force, DealBooks Mark Scott reports.

title: Wastewater Is for Lovers
description: Love stinks.

title: Its Always 1923
description: David Glasner writes sensibly about the currency war issue and related subjects, set off by recent commentary by Irwin Stelzer. As Glasner says, expansionary monetary policy can cause currency depreciation  but it is not currency manipulation. Theres a world of difference between Chinese-style intervention-plus-tight-money and either the Feds quantitative easing or Japans new turn to inflation targeting.

title: To Build Lasting Peace in Mali
description: LONDON  Clashes between Islamic fighters and French troops in the Malian city of Gao may suggest that, after a swift campaign to liberate the north, France could be in Mali for the long haul.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Amazon Challenges Netflix, and an Advertiser Turns to Cat Videos
description: Amazon.com is slowly building a library of streaming television shows and movies to rival that of Netflix, much to the satisfaction of media companies like Time Warner and CBS, Brian Stelter writes. Amazon will not unveil its own original shows until fall at the earliest, but it has spent hundreds of millions of dollars to win exclusive Web rights on shows for its Amazon Prime streaming service, like Downton Abbey from PBS and Falling Skies from TNT. Amazon is a long way from matching Netflix in terms of TV and movie selection, but parts of the media business already see the company as Pepsi to Netflixs Coke. Other companies, including Google, Sony, Intel and a new venture by Redbox and Verizon, are scrambling for a Snapple or Red Bull.

title: Tuesday Reading: Hospitals Cant Give Decent Price Quotes
Where Do Facts Come From?
description: Just a quick observation: for the past couple of days Ive been seeing in a lot of places, including comments on this blog, the assertion that federal spending has risen 37 percent under Obama  that specific number. Does anyone know where its coming from? Because if I look at the actual data, I see federal spending rising from $3.475 trillion in fourth-quarter 2008 to $3.917 trillion in fourth-quarter 2012  a rise of 12.7 percent.

title: Benedict Will Live in Vatican City, but Many Details Remain Undecided

Numerous reports identified the gunman as David T. Matusiewicz, a disgraced optometrist, who grabbed headlines in for kidnapping his three young daughters from their mother and taking them on an 18-month journey to Panama, Costa Rica, Mexico and Nicaragua beginning in 2007.

title: In Performance: Mercedes Herrero and Andy Paris of The Laramie Project
description: The Tectonic Theater Projects 2000 docu-play, The Laramie Project, is based on interviews with 200 people after the 1998 murder of Matthew Shepard, a gay 21-year-old student in Laramie, Wyo. In 2010 the company went back to Laramie to interview several of those people again and then created The Laramie Project: Ten Years Later. The two works will be performed in repertory, featuring members of the original cast, at the Harvey Theater of the Brooklyn Academy of Music from Tuesday through Feb. 24th. In these scenes from The Laramie Project, Mercedes Herrero plays Reggie Fluty, the officer who discovered Matthew Shepards body, and Andy Paris plays Dr. Cantway, the doctor who tended to him.

title: The Long, Long Run: Glenn Frey and Don Henley Reflect on History of the Eagles
description: They were the band that simultaneously told listeners to take it easy and take it to the limit, and for the Eagles, the contradictions didnt end there. Over a career filled with laidback hits like Peaceful Easy Feeling, Lyin Eyes and the enigmatic Hotel California, this best-selling rock group, led by Glenn Frey and Don Henley, was internally a caldron of professional determination and personal conflict. They spent the 1970s fighting, drinking and drugging while frequently revising their lineup and their sound, and seemed to split for good in 1980. Then, just to throw everyone for a loop, the band reunited in 1994 and has continued to tour and record ever since.

title: Australian Report on Israels Prisoner X Suggests Melbourne Man Was Mossad Agent
description: Last Updated, 2:53 p.m. The Australian Broadcasting Corporation reported on Tuesday that a man referred to in Israel as Prisoner X, who was jailed and died under mysterious circumstances in 2010, might have been an Australian-born Israeli who worked for Israels secret service, the Mossad.

title: Photos: Baseball Is Back
description: People who checked their Twitter feed Tuesday probably could not help but notice that baseball is back, as pitchers and catchers began reporting to training camps.

title: Guided by the Northern Lights
description: A single blue icicle. An empty beach. Clouds in a blank pewter sky. Leafless birches. Someone rolling in the snow, naked.

title: Illustrating the Importance of Words, Letter by Letter
description: Arismendy Feliz used to hold monthly reading workshops at a struggling middle school in the South Bronx. It was not the students, but the parents  many of them Latin-American or West African immigrants  who needed help with the ABCs.

title: Ryanair Says Aer Lingus Bid Will Be Rejected
description: PARIS  Even the third time may not be the charm for Ryanairs attempt to take over Irelands flag carrier Aer Lingus.

title: Outrage at a North Korean Nuclear Test
description: Richard Haass on the diplomatic fallout. | William Broad on what it means for the Norths nuclear program.

title: A Teaching Kitchen for Brooklyn Brewery
description: By the end of the year, Brooklyn Brewery will add a teaching kitchen for classes and events in 1,100 square feet of space on its second floor, overlooking the brewhouse. Steve Hindy, an owner, has hired Andrew Gerson, who was at Antica Pesa in Rome and in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, to be the chef-instructor. Mr. Gerson plans to use local ingredients to highlight the beers. Garrett Oliver, the brewmaster, will also be involved. And unlike most teaching kitchens, Mr. Hindy said, it would have a good draft system.

title: Don Johnson Settles Nash Bridges Lawsuit
description: In the seemingly perennial battle between producers of TV shows and the people who star in them, Don Johnson has notched a victory,quietly pocketing $19 million in a settlement with the company that produced his long-ago CBS crime series, Nash Bridges.

title: Photo Replay: Feb. 12
description: A view of the day in sports, as baseball training camps started filling up with pitchers and catchers in Florida.

title: Dreaming of a Custom Statuette for Every Winner
description: Completists already planning their Oscar party have an array of dcor options, especially if theyre into graphic design. The Academy just released its poster for this years ceremony, commissioned from the young British artist Olly Moss in collaboration with Gallery1988. His witty illustration for the 85th show includes a look back at the preceding decades, with 84 Oscar statuettes inspired by each years best picture winner. See if you can guess which one is Shakespeare in Love or Crash.

title: The Charges Are Flying Over a Test of Teslas Charging Network
description: The account in Sundays Automobiles section of The Times detailing my troubled East Coast road trip in a Tesla Model S sedan has generated quite a lot of commentary on the Internet, on Twitter and in the news media. Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, issued several tweets and was interviewed on CNBC Monday afternoon, where he disputed some aspects of the article.

title: Photos of The Moment | Donna Karan New York

title: Why Is Verizon Reviewing Smartphone Apps?
description: Android phones have access to hundreds of thousands of apps, but not all are worth buying or downloading. Verizon Wireless is stepping in to call out the ones that are good and bad.

title: A Small But Full-Featured Keyboard for the iPad Mini
description: While the small size of the iPad Mini is its charm, it is also a liability. The challenge of typing on a glass keyboard increases as its size shrinks.

title: Bitterly Divided Senate Panel Backs Hagel for Defense
description: WASHINGTON  After a combative two-hour debate that tested the bounds of Senate collegiality, the Armed Services Committee on Tuesday approved the nomination of former Senator Chuck Hagel as defense secretary on a sharply partisan vote.

title: 10 Questions: David Axelrod
description: David Axelrod, President Obamas longtime strategist, has completed his full-time White House service and overseen his last political campaign. But Mr. Axelrod still advises Mr. Obama even as he has started a new Institute of Politics at the University of Chicago.

title: Francisco Says Hes at Level Zero With Elbow
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Frank Francisco will have to wait until some inflammation dissipates from his elbow before he can defend his assertion that he should be the Mets closer this season.

title: Those Taking Higher Education Credits Can File Taxes on Thursday
description: Taxpayers claiming higher education credits are getting a valentine from the Internal Revenue Service: They can begin filing their tax returns on Thursday, the agency announced this week.

title: American Vermouth: Anything Goes
description: At one time it shared equal billing with gin in the martini. But when that cocktail went dry, vermouth was relegated to the back of the bar. Worse than uncool, it became irrelevant.

title: Politics in Bangladesh Jolted by Daily Demonstrations
description: NEW DELHI  Huge daily demonstrations in the heart of Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, are upending the nations politics and illustrating how heavily the countrys bloody past still weighs on its present. Thousands of protesters, most of them college students and other young people, demonstrated again on Tuesday, fueled by broad public anger over a recent ruling by the countrys special war crimes tribunal that they say was too lenient.

title: Satellites Reveal Depletion of a Vital Middle East Water Supply
description: Just in case you needed more reasons to be concerned about the stability of the Middle East, new research using data from NASAs gravity-sensing Grace satellites shows a substantial decline in the volume of groundwater reserves in the Tigris and Euphrates river basins. Data gathered between 2003 and 2009 show the seasonal recharge of the regions aquifers (the blue pulses in the illuminating animation above) but then the onset of a potent drought in 2007 followed by a persistent big drop in water amounts, 60 percent of which is ascribed to unsustainable rates of pumping in a study to be published on Friday in the journal Water Resources Research.

title: In Europe, a Risk-Filled Choice for Britain
description: LONDON  BM Catalysts, a British producer of catalytic converters and other car exhaust parts, is an example of the kind of successful exporter that might seem to validate the historic gamble that Prime Minister David Cameron has taken by raising the prospect of Britains departure from the European Union.

title: Stargazing: New York Fashion Week, Day 5
description: As the lights dimmed at Theyskens Theory show on Monday afternoon, a grizzled Olivier Zahm slipped into his seat near Terry Richardson, who was giving the photographers his trademark thumbs up.

title: Obama Pledges Push to Lift Economy for Middle Class
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, seeking to put the prosperity and promise of the middle class at the heart of his second-term agenda, called on Congress on Tuesday night to raise the federal minimum wage to $9 an hour, saying that would lift millions out of poverty and energize the economy.

title: A Table Set for Two
description: Outtakes is a new occasional feature on the story behind the photographs in the Dining section.

description: Jonah Lehrer, the journalist whose self-borrowings and fabricated quotes led last summer to his firing from The New Yorker and the withdrawal of his best-selling book Imagine, appeared at a community journalism conference in Miami on Tuesday to offer his first extensive public statement about his misdeeds.

description: Marc Jacobs holds a pre-party at the Harvard Club.

title: Why a Victim of Sandy Doesnt Want an S.B.A. Loan
description: Last week, we published a case study about Ralph Lucci, owner of Automobile Film Club of America, a company that has supplied vehicles for film and television productions since 1993. Based in Stapleton, on Staten Island near the waterfront, the companys lot and 57 cars were flooded last October during Hurricane Sandys surge.

description: Investors want more cash from Apple.

description: Opening

title: Never Mind the Dictionary: Justice Is Spelled With a Z
description: How can you lure children raised on computer-generated imagery and high-tech special effects to a swashbuckling adventure with only three actors, a few props and dozens of plastic cutouts? Youd need clever design, highly skilled performers and plenty of fancy footwork.

title: Justin Bieber, Lady Gaga and Madonna Go Clubbing
description: A disclaimer: Your humble critic usually doesnt drink when reviewing shows. It can be challenging to wield the critics ax responsibly under the influence.

title: White Paper on 340B Hospitals
description: In a white paper, pharmaceutical industry trade groups say that some hospitals have gone overboard in using a drug discount program known as 340B.

title: How MacFarlane and the Academy Help Each Other
description: LOS ANGELESIs Seth MacFarlane going to help the Oscars, or are the Oscars going to help Seth MacFarlane?

title: A Top UBS Executive Is to Depart
description: Carsten Kengeter, the former head of UBSs investment bank, has been on the outs at the Swiss banking giant for some time. On Tuesday, the bank announced that he was resigning.

title: Do the Dinner Kits Deliver?
description: THE TWO WEEKS I spent cooking dinner from the kits available in New York City were surprisingly pleasant. As a veteran of the scramble to feed a family of four after work, I found it restful to bypass the stress of choosing a recipe at work, mentally mapping the ingredients (is there still some chicken stock in the freezer?) and sprinting through the market on the way home.

title: Everything but the Cook
description: Nick Taranto thinks you should cook your own dinner tonight. He even thinks you might pay him for the privilege.

title: Rodarte and Diesel Make for Easy Riders
description: Tie-dye and beaded angels wings were the most graphic elements of a Rodarte collection that had people talking about skaters, goth and bikers. There were a lot of disparate elements to digest in the multilayered outfits of the sisters Kate and Laura Mulleavy, and it might take some time to sort them all out.

title: Palestines Democratic Deficit
description: LAST week, a 26-year-old Palestinian activist, Anas Awwad,  was sentenced in absentia by a court in Nablus, the West Bank, to one year in prison for extending his tongue against the Palestinian Authoritys president, Mahmoud Abbas, on Facebook. Thousands have joined a Facebook group to show their solidarity with Mr. Awwad, but the damage has been done. Free speech has been set back, and a chill sent throughout Palestinian society.

title: Peter Soms Digital Runway

title: Senate Votes Overwhelmingly to Expand Domestic Violence Act
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate, with broad bipartisan support, voted overwhelmingly Tuesday to expand the reach of the landmark Violence Against Women Act of 1994 by fortifying the power of American Indian tribal courts and explicitly protecting gay victims of domestic abuse.

title: Diesel Black Gold: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Choose Enough Body
description: The rich, juicy guinea hen in David Taniss column, along with the mouthwatering combination of rosemary, garlic and lemon, pairs wonderfully with any number of wines, red and white. For whites, Id want deep rather than delicate, an Alsatian riesling, for example, which has enough body to match the hen, or a dry Vouvray from a riper vintage, like 2009. Good red choices abound: a cru Beaujolais, a Burgundy with enough age to be past its reticence or a savory St.-Joseph that hasnt seen much new oak.

title: Russia May Restrict Investing Abroad
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin introduced a draft law on Tuesday that would bar senior Russian officials from holding bank accounts or stocks outside Russia, the latest in a series of recent measures intended to insulate the countrys governance from foreign influences.

title: Dispute Develops Over Discount Drug Program
description: When a private oncology practice in Memphis formed a partnership with a nearby hospital in late 2011, the organizations proclaimed that the deal would transform cancer care in the region.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Mali, Bangladesh and West Bank.

title: Comcast Buys Rest of NBC in Early Sale
description: 9:28 a.m. | Updated Comcast gave NBCUniversal a $16.7 billion vote of confidence on Tuesday, agreeing to pay that sum to acquire General Electrics remaining 49 percent stake in the entertainment company. The deal accelerated a sales process that was expected to take several more years.

title: A 102-Year-Old Face of Voting Delays at the State of the Union
description: In the first ladys box at the State of the Union address on Tuesday night, Desiline Victor, 102, will be seated among Michelle Obamas guests as a symbol of voters who faced long delays as they tried to cast ballots in last years elections.

title: Unusual Moves in Confronting Apples Huge Pile of Cash
description: The fight over Apples $140 billion cash pile is proving the adage that money can make people do strange things.

title: A Patch that Monitors the Body
description: The International Consumer Electronics Show had its share of activity measuring devices, from tiny clips that hang on a pocket to lanyards and wristbands that convert a phone into a private coach.

title: Authorities to Determine if Remains Are of California Fugitive
description: BIG BEAR LAKE, Calif.  After a shootout and a forest standoff on Tuesday afternoon, Christopher J. Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer sought in the regions largest manhunt, was apparently killed in a cabin as it burned down around him, but officials said they needed time to sort through the rubble.

title: Coca-Cola Lifts Profit, but Shares Close Down
description: Facing challenges from foreign exchange rates, reduced demand for carbonated beverages and bumpy markets in Europe and China, Coca-Cola still managed to increase its fourth-quarter profit, the company said on Tuesday.

title: For Sciences Sake, Its Mohawk Guy
description: To highlight science education and memorable haircuts, one of the guests in Michelle Obamas box during the State of the Union speech Tuesday night will be the Mohawk Guy  Bobak Ferdowsi, a member of the team operating NASAs Mars Curiosity rover who is best known for his spiky, red- and blue-streaked haircut and the stars shaved on the side of his head.

title: Read Any Good Web Sites Lately? Book Lovers Talk Online
description: Lori Hettler is a passionate reader, tearing through about 80 books a year. But as a resident of a Pennsylvania town and with a preference for fiction from small publishers, she can have trouble finding new books to feed her habit.

title: A Museum Broadens Its Identity
description: Directors of large institutions often spend their first year on the job mapping out their plans while their predecessors last projects hold the spotlight. Claudia Gould, the Jewish Museums new director, has had another task as well: juggling other peoples expectations and fears about her intentions for the museum, an unwanted distraction as she prepares to revitalize an institution that even its supporters admit has become staid.

title: Silenced in Israel, Spy Tale Unfolds in Australia
description: JERUSALEM  The story had all the trappings of a spy thriller: an anonymous prisoner linked to Israels secret service, Mossad, isolated in a top-security wing originally built for the assassin of a prime minister. A suicide  or was it a murder?  never officially reported. A gag order that barred journalists from even acknowledging the gag order. And a code name to rival 007: Prisoner X.

title: Pamela Druckermans Favorite French Parenting Advice
description: Here is the thing about French parenting: many of us, people who will never, ever look good with a scarf tied around our necks, can get just a little defensive when the French are held up as an example.

title: Front Burner
description: To Give: Just to Say: Valentine, Youre Cute as a BugRed ladybug truffles and golden bees with liquid honey caramel swarm the Bee My Lovebug collection from John & Kiras, an artisanal chocolate company in Philadelphia. Or instead of bugging your Valentine, consider the Enchanted Garden, a box of colorful fruit, with oranges filled with orange and white chocolate, apples with a spiced chocolate filling, and cherries filled with a brandied ganache. The candies can be ordered in time for Thursday: $29 at johnandkiras.com, and at Chelsea Market Baskets.

title: Champions League: Round of 16 Returns
description: The UEFA Champions League returned Tuesday with the start of the Round of 16. After a winter break we continue a featurette in which we hope to bring Goal readers video of the best (and most important) goals of the day, courtesy of Fox Soccer.

title: Syrian Rebels Say They Have Seized a Military Airfield and Its Warplanes
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian insurgents seized control of a northern military airfield on Tuesday and captured usable warplanes for the first time in the nearly two-year-old conflict, according to rebels and activist groups. The development, if confirmed, would represent the second strategic setback for President Bashar al-Assads government this week.

title: Saving Karachis Street Children, One Goal at a Time
description: Twisting themselves into funnel clouds, Karachis flies compete with scurrying cockroaches, frantic to feast upon the same garbage as the children. Children scavenge the piles of filth, braving the stench of urine, in search of something salvageable, wearable, edible, drinkable, inhalable. Imprinted on the lens of dust that permeates the city is the image of Karachis voiceless population: its street children.

description: The Lede tracked the manhunt for Christopher Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer, on Tuesday.

title: In Shovels, a Remedy for Jobs and Growth
description: The budget deficit in 2013 is expected to fall below $1 trillion for the first time in five years. Perhaps policy makers in Washington can now focus on the other $1 trillion deficit, one that gets next to no attention yet is much more threatening to the well-being of American families: our sluggish economic growth.

title: Live Coverage of Obamas State of the Union Address
description: President Obama delivers his State of the Union address Tuesday night and Times reporters are providing live updates and analysis. It is our unfinished task to make sure that this government works on behalf of the many, and not just the few, Mr. Obama will say, according to brief excerpts that the White House released Tuesday evening.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  What do computer programmers and illegal immigrants have to do with each other?

title: Marching to an African Beat
description: SALVADOR, Brazil  On Sunday at noon, some 15,000 people were mustered for a parade at Campo Grande, Salvadors Central Park  part of the annual six-day carnaval here that ended on Tuesday. This parade was a show of solidarity: the first massed public performance of the citys blocos afro, the Afro-Brazilian drum groups that are also neighborhood associations and self-help initiatives in some of the citys poorest neighborhoods.

title: The Daily Do | Rodarte
description: When one do just wont do, Rodarte offered an enchanting two-for-one: Nonchalant braided hair twisted into a rose-bud sized soft bun.

title: Polls Show Dissatisfaction With Countrys Direction, but Support for Obamas Agenda
description: Just ahead of President Obamas State of the Union address Tuesday night, new polls find continued public dissatisfaction with the direction of the country, yet support for several of the policies the president has said he will push in his second term.

description: One-third of the nations hospitals are now enrolled in a drug discount program called 340B.

description: An exclusive peek at the moments before the models stepped out onto the catwalk at Victoria Beckhams show on Sunday morning at the New York Public Library.

description: By the time the economy is projected to recover to its potential, we will have lost about $7.5 trillion in economic output.

description: FROM PETRARCH TO MARK TWAIN, travelers have been chronicling their journeys for as long as they have climbed mountains and crossed oceans.

title: New Arts Research Center to Open at S.M.U.
description: Hoping to derive a more accurate picture of the health of the nations art sector, Southern Methodist University in Dallas and the Cultural Data Project in Philadelphia announced on Tuesday that they had jointly created a new National Center for Arts Research, a clearinghouse for arts research.

title: 5 Firehouses Recognized as City Landmarks
description: The New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission voted on the fate of five stout buildings on Tuesday. Some of the structures are faced with brownstone and others limestone, some are made of red brick and others orange, but they have one thing in common: prominent garage doors painted a bright, fiery red.

title: Rewarding Those Who Dare to Move Forward
description: Only in fashion do people think they can evolve by going backward. Designers either want the energy of a bygone youth culture or, as the phrase goes, they want to return to their roots. To a fan of music or the movies, this would be like getting a new impersonation of Jagger or Brando every six months.

title: For Men, Style Without the Snickers
description: Men, look how far you have come.

title: X Games in France Drop Snowmobile
description: The Winter X Games next month in Tignes, France, will not feature a snowmobile freestyle demonstration because organizers continue to review the events safety procedures after the death of Caleb Moore.

title: New Hubs Arise to Serve Just in Case Distribution
description: Major storms like Hurricane Sandy and other unexpected events have prompted some companies to modify the popular just-in-time style of doing business, in which only small amounts of inventory are kept on hand, to fashion what is known as just-in-case management.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Tom Pecheuxs Skin-Reviving Secret
description: Every time an exhausted model plops into the French makeup artist Tom Pecheuxs chair with a dull, fatigued complexion (an increasingly common occurrence toward the end of New York Fashion Week), its his job to get her skin runway-ready as quickly as possible. Here, he shares with T his secret strategy for re-energizing and brightening the face in no time.

title: Living With Water
description: The Dutch are contriving to live with nature, rather than fight a losing battle.
