description: WASHINGTON  If drone pilots and computer experts had any doubts that they truly are central to the new way of combat, Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta used his valedictory Pentagon news conference on Wednesday to make it clear: he established a new medal just for them.

title: Live Photo Streaming Now: Proenza Schouler
description: Check in daily to see in-the-moment backstage, on and off the runway photos from select New York Fashion Week shows.

title: Protesters in Dresden Block Neo-Nazi March on Anniversary of Deadly Allied Firebombing
description: Thousands of anti-fascist protesters blocked a neo-Nazi march in Dresden, Germany, on Wednesday night, on the 68th anniversary of the British and American air campaign that killed an estimated 25,000 people in 37 hours of bombing.

title: American and US Airways Announce Deal for $11 Billion Merger
description: 8:53 a.m. | Updated

title: Marchesa: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Anna Sui: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Comptroller Criticizes Budget Plan of Governor
description: New York States comptroller, Thomas P. DiNapoli, questioned parts of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos budget proposal on Wednesday, asserting that the spending plan relied on optimistic economic projections and would burden the state with even greater debt.

title: Out of Sight, but Making His Presence Known
description: Necks craned at Oscar de la Rentas show to see if two men would take their bow. If you havent heard, John Galliano spent the last month working in the de la Renta studio, a first move to possibly salvaging his wrecked career.

title: A Course That Woods Has Yet to Master
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, Calif.

title: Cardinal Dolan Calls Popes Resignation a Sign of Humility
description: On a day when Roman Catholics around the world had ashes pressed to their foreheads as a mark of humility and penance, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, the archbishop of New York, said the resignation of Pope Benedict XVI was a living example of the days message.

title: Obama Resubmits Appointees for Labor Board
description: Despite opposition from nearly all Senate Republicans, President Obama asked the Senate on Wednesday to confirm two Democrats whose recess appointments to the National Labor Relations Board were ruled unconstitutional by a federal appeals court last month.

title: In High-Tech Japan, the Fax Machines Roll On
description: TOKYO  Japan is renowned for its robots and bullet trains, and has some of the worlds fastest broadband networks. But it also remains firmly wedded to a pre-Internet technology  the fax machine  that in most other developed nations has joined answering machines, eight-tracks and cassette tapes in the dustbin of outmoded technologies.

title: Inspector in 2008 Crane Collapse Gets Probation
description: He was arrested amid great fanfare nearly five years ago, a city employee accused of fabricating an inspection report of a towering crane, which later collapsed and killed seven people.

title: SAC Capital Manager Awaits Word on Charges
description: Federal prosecutors are nearing a decision whether to bring criminal charges against Michael Steinberg, a longtime portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors, the giant hedge fund owned by the billionaire investor Steven A. Cohen.

title: New Panera Bread Campaign
description: A new commercial features a Rube Goldberg machine that imitates the daily routine at a Panera.

title: Obama Bid for Europe Trade Pact Stirs Hope on Both Sides
description: BERLIN  President Obamas call for a free-trade agreement between the United States and the European Union has unleashed a wave of optimism on both sides that a breakthrough can be achieved that would lift trans-Atlantic fortunes, not just economically but politically.

title: To Survive I.O.C. Cut, Pentathlon Changed
description: This week, unfamiliar horses prevailed over familiar wrestlers.

title: Cuomo to Cities: Just Borrow
description: SYRACUSE

title: Neo-Classical Republicanism
description: OAKLAND, Calif.

title: Preventing a Currency War
description: The Group of 7 industrialized countries appeared to tamp down talk of a currency war in a statement this week that said markets should determine exchange rates and that countries should use fiscal and monetary policies to achieve faster growth. It may help curb fears that stagnant economies will devalue their currencies to make their exports more affordable relative to competitors.

title: The Real Obama
description: Is this the real Barack Obama? I hope so. I like this one.

title: Selling Products by Selling Shared Values
description: THE purpose of marketing is to sell products, but there is also a new way, known as purpose, or purpose-based, marketing, to do it.

title: A Court for Targeted Killings
description: No American prosecutor can imprison or execute someone except on the orders of a judge or jury. That fundamental principle applies no less to the suspected terrorists that the executive branch chooses to kill overseas, particularly in the case of American citizens.

title: A Workout Booster, and a Lawsuit
description: For the last few weeks, GNC, the dietary supplements retailer, has run a special on its Web site for a workout booster called Jack3d. Hot Buy, Hot Buy, Hot Buy, reads a red banner splashed across the products page.

title: A Tentative Step by a Fallen Star to Come Back
description: The disgraced fashion designer John Galliano was nowhere to be seen at Oscar de la Rentas fashion show on Tuesday night, though the luminaries in attendance, including Anna Wintour, Valentino and Diane von Furstenberg, were certainly aware of his presence, as were the paparazzi lined up three deep on the sidewalk 25 floors below on West 42nd Street.

title: A Heartbroken Temp at Brides.com
description: DRIVING across the George Washington Bridge in the spring of 2006, with everything I owned in the trunk and Manhattan shining in the distance, I might have been the most clichd girl in America. I tried not to dwell on the fact that I had no money, no apartment, no job.

title: When Divorce Is a Family Affair
A Millennial Voice
description: To the Editor:

title: Lawsuit Over S.&P. Ratings
description: To the Editor:

title: Police Surveillance: The View From the N.Y.P.D.
description: To the Editor:

title: Seeking Growth, Nurses Union Links to Teachers Union
description: One of the nations largest nurses unions  the National Federation of Nurses  plans to announce on Thursday that it will affiliate with the far larger American Federation of Teachers.

title: Reducing Health Care Costs
description: To the Editor:

title: The Presidents Second-Term Agenda
description: To the Editor:

title: 100th Self-Immolation Reported Inside Tibet
description: A former Tibetan Buddhist monk protested Chinese rule by killing himself through self-immolation this month, becoming the 100th person to do so inside Chinese-governed Tibet, according to reports on Wednesday by Tibet advocacy groups.

title: Final Plea for Mercy
description: Warren Lee Hill Jr., with an I.Q. of 70, is scheduled to be executed on Tuesday in Georgia. The Supreme Court should stay the execution, as his lawyers have requested, and recognize that Georgia makes it too hard for an offender to prove retardation.

title: Another Step Toward Fairness
description: Leon Panetta, the departing secretary of defense, took an important step on Monday to improve treatment of gay and lesbian military personnel and their families.

title: Ponikarovsky Returns to Devils
description: The Devils reacquired the 6-foot-4 forward Alexei Ponikarovsky, a key member of the team that reached the Stanley Cup finals last season, General Manager Lou Lamoriello said Wednesday night.

title: Soccer Fixing Inquiry Hinges on a Shadowy Singaporean
description: ROME  Near the beginning of an Italian soccer match in Tuscany on May 23, 2010, a man from Singapore named Tan Seet Eng spoke on the phone with a Croatian associate. He told the associate he needed at least three goals to be scored in the match between Grosseto and Reggina.

title: In India, Kisses Are on Rise, Even in Public
description: NEW DELHI  India may be the birthplace of the Kama Sutra, the ancient how-to manual on kissing and sex. But for many years, Indian couples did not widely embrace kissing, at least not in public. Now that is changing.

title: Quinns Affordable Housing Plan Revisits Tax Caps Once Rejected by Bloomberg
description: A centerpiece of Christine C. Quinns plan to keep housing affordable in New York City is a variation on a proposed tax subsidy for landlords that Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg forcefully rejected two years ago as an unacceptably generous giveaway to the real estate industry.

title: On Second Thoughts
description: President Obama is pushing hard to persuade Congress to back off from the brutal spending cuts  $1.2 trillion  mandated by the sequestration provisions of the Budget Control Act, which he signed into law on Aug. 2, 2011.In a simultaneous but unrelated development, Karl Rove is pressing top Republican donors to back his Conservative Victory Project, an organization designed to snuff out the candidacies of right-wing extremists in Republican primaries who, in 2010 and 2012, prevented the party from winning a Senate majority.

title: Scorecard for Colleges Needs Work, Experts Say
description: The steps that President Obama promised in his State of the Union address to control college costs and give consumers more information on the prices and values of individual colleges drew tepid responses on Wednesday from educational groups, who said the measures seemed generally positive but had many blanks to be filled in.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Feb. 14, 2013
description: If you use a gun, you usually dont get a second chance.

title: State-Financed Preschool Access in the U.S.
description: In his State of the Union address, President Obama called for preschool education access for every child in America. Nationally, 28 percent of 4 year-olds are enrolled in state-financed preschools, but not all states offer programs.

title: Anger That a Herod Show Uses West Bank Objects
description: JERUSALEM  In one room sits a sarcophagus of reddish-pink limestone believed to have held the body of King Herod, painstakingly reconstructed after having been smashed to bits centuries ago. In another, there are frescoes from Herods elaborate underground palace, pieced together like a jigsaw puzzle. Throughout, elaborate animated videos show the kings audacious construction  atop the desert fortress Masada; at his burial place, Herodium; and his most famous work, the Second Temple of Jerusalem.

title: New Jersey Assembly Panel Backs Tougher Gun Laws
description: The New Jersey Legislature took up a collection of nearly two dozen bills on Wednesday that would tighten gun controls, prompting angry protests from hundreds of gun rights advocates who crowded the State House.

title: Detroit Mayor Says City Is Making Progress on Debt
description: With a crucial review of Detroits financial circumstances expected within days and the possibility of a state-appointed financial manager looming, Mayor Dave Bing on Wednesday evening made the case for his city, arguing that Detroits finances are getting better, bit by bit.

title: Lottery Numbers
For Dickey and the Blue Jays, the Moment Is Now
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.

title: threeASFOUR: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Some Affordable Units Too Costly, Report Says
description: In a city that measures wealth in square feet, even apartments marketed as affordable housing can still be too expensive for many New Yorkers.

title: Corrections: February 14, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Welcoming Symbol
description: Administrivial Alert! Will Shortz has written the intro to a wonderful new project, American Red Crosswords. Some of my puzzle buddies have donated their incredible talents to this wonderful cause, which will donate all funds earned to survivors of Hurricane Sandy. Hat tip to Michael Sharp/Rex Parker for captaining the project. Click here to find out more.

title: Prosecutor Who Assaulted Ambulance Worker Avoids Jail Sentence
description: Before a courtroom filled with dozens of emergency medical workers, a prosecutor in the Brooklyn district attorneys office was sentenced to 10 days of community service on Wednesday after pleading guilty to assaulting an ambulance worker as the prosecutor was being taken to a hospital.

title: Booker Assails an Attack and Those Who Kept Silent
description: NEWARK  Beating his fist on a lectern Wednesday, Mayor Cory A. Booker railed not only at three men charged with forcing another man to strip naked before savagely whipping him and capturing it on video, but especially at those who knew about the attack and did not tell the police.

title: Hitching a Name to a Star, Then Watching It Set
description: MARKTL AM INN, Germany  If we rebuild it, they will come, thought the residents of Marktl am Inn, Pope Benedict XVIs hometown, and for a while they did. But visitors to the museum in the house where he was born, brightly repainted in the white and yellow colors of the Vatican, had begun to taper off well before his abrupt resignation this week.

title: Senate Democrats, Accusing G.O.P. of Obstruction, Try to Force Hagel Vote
description: WASHINGTON  Accusing Republicans of a new level of obstruction, Senate Democrats moved on Wednesday to force a vote on President Obamas nomination of Chuck Hagel to be secretary of defense.

title: Sexual Harassment Case Against Lopez Sent to Legislature
description: ALBANY  State regulators referred ethics violations in the sexual harassment scandal surrounding Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez to the Legislature on Wednesday, but did not specify what charges had been made in the case.

title: Proenza Schouler: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Excerpt: Zero Hour
description: Anthony Edwards stars in a new ABC suspense series.

title: Russian Parliament Ethics Chief Steps Aside Over Reports of Undisclosed Properties
description: MOSCOW  The chairman of the ethics committee in Russias lower house of Parliament temporarily relinquished his authority on Wednesday after bloggers posted a raft of documents on the Internet showing him as the owner of expensive real estate, including a luxury oceanfront apartment in South Beach, part of Miami Beach, as well as valuable property in Russia that he did not list on required disclosure forms.

title: Iranian Reported Killed Near Syrian Border
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  At least one senior Iranian official was reported killed in an attack while driving from Syria to Lebanon on Wednesday, in separate and at times conflicting reports that drew attention to suspicions of Irans role in the Syrian civil war.

title: The State of the 4-Year-Olds
description: One of the big moments of the State of the Union address was President Obamas call for high-quality preschool for 4-year-olds.

title: Nets as Baffling as Ever, but This Time They Win
description: P. J. Carlesimo is a coach of many words, with a knack for weaving expansive answers out of mundane questions, and even longer soliloquies when the subject is complex. Assessing the Nets prospects at the All-Star break took a lot of words, even by Carlesimos standards, perhaps understandably.

title: Falling Far Short of the Whole Truth
description: In a stately, old London courtroom, Soma Sengupta was finally living her dream.

title: Proenza Schouler: A Sense of Softness
description: Even in the backstage confines of the Proenza Schouler show, as models were getting dressed, the clothes didnt look exactly soft and touchable. After all, Jack McCollough and Lazaro Hernandez had made dresses embroidered in vertical lines of chain. And some of their new ostrich skirts and coats looked pretty rigid.

title: A Painful Decision for Pettitte
description: At 40, Andy Pettitte has done virtually everything he set out to do as a major league pitcher, compiling 245 career victories, winning 20 games twice and earning five World Series rings. But one thing remained for him: representing the United States in international competition.

title: Yankees Add a Reliever
description: Late Wednesday, the Yankees bolstered their middle relief by acquiring the right-hander Shawn Kelley from Seattle for the minor league outfielder Abraham Almonte.

title: General Urged to Take Time to Decide on NATO Post
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta disclosed Wednesday that he met this week with Gen. John R. Allen, the outgoing commander in Afghanistan, and urged him to take time off with his family before deciding whether to accept or decline the presidents nomination to be the senior NATO commander.

title: Jake McNiece, Who Led Incorrigible D-Day Unit, Is Dead at 93
description: D-Day started early for Sgt. Jake McNiece and his fellow paratroopers. Not long after midnight on June 6, 1944, they parachuted behind German lines just ahead of the invasion of Normandy. Their goal was to destroy Nazi supply lines and escape routes. Some called it a suicide mission. The paratroopers called themselves the Filthy 13.

title: Nets Taylor Is Eager to Prove Hes No One-Game Fluke
description: The first big break of Tyshawn Taylors career, one might say, arrived at a playground in Clearwater, Fla., when Taylor was 8, shooting hoops alone outside his housing complex.

title: A New Orleans-Washington Handshake Turns to Fists
description: NEW ORLEANS  Two days after his inauguration in May 2010, Mayor Mitch Landrieu sent a letter to Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. that began: I am writing today to ask for your support and partnership in transforming the New Orleans Police Department into one of the best police forces in the United States.

title: Alan Sharp, Writer of Dark Screenplays, Dies at 79
description: Alan Sharp, a screenwriter whose brand of dark, lyrical and densely plotted work, including the screenplay for Arthur Penns Night Moves, made him a critically admired if largely unknown figure in Hollywood, died on Friday in Los Angeles. He was 79.

title: Four Years Later, Slain Abortion Doctors Aide Steps Into the Void
description: WICHITA, Kan.  For nearly four years the site has been abandoned, a low-slung, windowless, beige building just off a highway on the east side of town. But the overpowering smell of fresh paint inside hints of activity soon to come.

title: Guns and Suicide
description: Researchers have noted that states with higher rates of gun ownership tend to have higher rates of suicide than states with less gun ownership.

title: Key Talks Set Over N.H.L. Participation in Olympics
description: The debate over whether N.H.L. players will participate in the 2014 Sochi Olympics will enter a critical stage with a series of meetings between league and Olympic officials in New York on Thursday and Friday.

title: To Reduce Suicide Rates, New Focus Turns to Guns
description: DAYTON, Wyo.  Craig Reichert found his sons body on a winter morning, lying on the floor as if he were napping with his great-uncles pistol under his knee. The 911 dispatcher told him to administer CPR, but Mr. Reichert, who has had emergency training, told her it was too late. His son, Kameron, 17, was already cold to the touch.

title: Quinnipiac Hits No. 1 With Lots of Whiskers and Up-Tempo Game
description: In early November, the Quinnipiac mens hockey team was 3-3-1, disjointed and selfish. Then it began to believe in a full-sprint offense, in killing penalties and blocking shots. Many players summoned what they called Muzzy Power, and the teams goalie harnessed his positive energy cells to help heighten his focus.

title: Knicks Start Slow and Finish Even Worse
description: Carmelo Anthony did not make excuses. That would not be the right way to assess the Knicks deflating 92-88 loss to the Toronto Raptors on Wednesday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Use of Morning-After Pill Is Rising, Report Says
description: The use of morning-after pills by American women has more than doubled in recent years, driven largely by rising rates of use among women in their early 20s, according to new federal data released Thursday.

title: Word of the Day | exceptionable
description: exceptionable \ik-sep-sh(-)n-bl\ adjective

title: Sports Illustrateds New Swimsuit Issue Rouses Ire Over Ethnic Props
description: BEIJING  Sports Illustrated magazines swimsuit issue has drawn criticism from feminists and other women, and some men, for unnecessarily sexualizing women and exhibiting bad taste. Or good taste, depending on your point of view.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 11:30 A.M. (Encore) GREMLINS 2: THE NEW BATCH (1990) The Gremlins take Manhattan in this sequel to the 1984 original. Billy and Kate (Zach Galligan and Phoebe Cates, above) are now working at the Clamp Center, a Midtown skyscraper that becomes overrun by the titular critters. In The New York Times, Janet Maslin wrote that the film, directed by Joe Dante, speaks to the gleeful hell-raising monster in each of us, and it speaks with much more verve, cleverness and good humor than the film on which it is based. She added that Christopher Lee, in his role as a scientist, is an irresistibly ghoulish presence, and the precise nature of his medical experiments  cows listening to self-help tapes, rats using their energy to run light bulbs  give the film an added measure of fun.

title: A Volatile Brahmaputra River Will Grow Only More So
description: ELOPA, Arunachal Pradesh  Amid a desert of volleyball-sized boulders, Jibi Pulu bounces his Tata jeep over a trickling nullah. In his childhood, just 30-odd years ago, this stream used to irrigate his family paddy fields right here in the flatlands and provide fresh water to his ancestral village in the hills above the floodplain of the Dibang River, a major tributary of the Brahmaputra.

title: News Quiz | February 14, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Photo Replay: Feb. 13
description: A view of the day in sports, from snowboarding to spring training.

title: 100th Self-Immolation Reported Inside Tibet
description: A former Tibetan Buddhist monk protested Chinese rule by killing himself through self-immolation this month, becoming the 100th person to do so inside Chinese-governed Tibet, according to reports on Wednesday by Tibet advocacy groups.

title: BNP Paribas Earnings Fall on Write-Downs
description: PARIS  BNP Paribas, Frances largest bank, posted a fourth-quarter profit far below estimates on Thursday as it wrote down the value of its Italian unit and booked an accounting charge on its own debt.

title: A Nation Reels as a Star Runner Is Charged in Girlfriends Death
description: JOHANNESBURG  She was a platinum-haired model on the cusp of the big time, about to make her debut on a reality television show. He was a global sports hero who, despite having had both legs amputated at the knee as an infant, ran so fast that in a 2011 Nike advertisement he declared, I am the bullet in the chamber. Reeva Steenkamp, the model, and Oscar Pistorius, the Paralympic champion and Olympic competitor, were glamorous young fixtures on the South African celebrity scene.

title: IHT Quick Read: Feb. 14
description: NEWS President Obamas call for a free-trade agreement between the United States and the European Union has unleashed a wave of optimism on both sides that a breakthrough can be achieved that would lift trans-Atlantic fortunes, not just economically but politically. Nicholas Kulish reports from Berlin, and Jackie Calmes from Washington.

title: Economy in Europe Contracts More Than Expected
description: European economies shrank in the fourth quarter at their fastest rate since the depth of the financial crisis in 2009, new data showed on Thursday, with both strong and weak countries falling short of expectations and raising anxieties of a longer, deeper recession.

title: Test Yourself | English, Feb. 14, 2013
description: The question was written by Jessica Lahey. It comes from the article Regulators Around the Globe Ground Boeing 787s.

title: Barbarians at the Gate
description: BERLIN  Theres a refugee camp in the center of the German capital filled with people who have fled conflicts around the world. They sleep in tents and eat donated food. Almost all of them are breaking German law just by being here.

title: Nuclear Watchdog Says No Deal Reached With Iran
description: PARIS  A senior official of the United Nations nuclear supervisory body said Thursday that talks a day earlier in Iran had ended inconclusively and that international inspectors had not been given access to a site that they suspect may have been used for testing bomb triggers.

title: Banana Joe, Best in Show
description: In No Ordinary Affenpinscher, Banana Joe Is Named Best in Show, Richard Sandomir writes about the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show.

title: Knowing That Fly on the Wall
description: Brad Vest is a freelance photojournalist based in Concord, N.H. He has spent the last several years working on Adrift, a project for his masters thesis at Ohio University. The series documents the life of Travis, a father who is trying to put his life back together after being incarcerated. Mr. Vest, 27, was a photo intern at The New York Times last summer and at National Geographic last fall. In 2012 he won the prestigious Cliff Edom Award in NPPAs Best of Photojournalism contest.

title: The Convergence of George Will and Sherrod Brown
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Can the Republicans Be Saved From Obsolescence?
description: One afternoon last month, I paid a visit to two young Republicans named Bret Jacobson and Ian Spencer, who work in a small office in Arlington, Va., situated above an antique store and adjacent to a Japanese auto shop. Their five-man company, Red Edge, is a digital-advocacy group for conservative causes, and their days are typically spent designing software applications for groups like the Heritage Foundation, the Republican Governors Association and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce. Lately, however, Jacobson and Spencer have taken up evangelizing  and the sermon, delivered day after day to fellow conservatives in the form of a 61-point presentation, is a pitiless we-told-you-so elucidation of the ways in which Democrats have overwhelmed Republicans with their technological superiority.

title: Read Any Good Books Lately?
description: Do you read for pleasure? What are some of your favorite books? Do you have a community of fellow readers with whom you share recommendations?

title: South Korea Shows Military Muscle in Sparring With North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea staged large military drills and disclosed a new cruise missile capable of hitting any target in North Korea, just days after the North said it detonated its third nuclear device and as Pyongyang became increasingly candid about its intentions to build intercontinental ballistic missiles tipped with nuclear warheads.

title: Asahi Sues 2 Private Equity Firms Over $1.3 Billion Deal
description: HONG KONG  The Japanese beer and beverage maker Asahi Group filed a lawsuit on Thursday in Australia against two buyout firms over its purchase of a liquor company for 1.53 billion New Zealand dollars two years ago.

title: Anheuser-Busch InBev Revises $20.1 Billion Takeover Plan
description: 7:20 p.m. | Updated

title: The Early Word: On the Road
description: In Todays Times:

title: What She Wore
description: In November 2010 the fine art photographer Catherine Opie gained entree into Elizabeth Taylors closet through their shared accountant, of all people. Opie, known for her documentary style, spent six months shooting the stars myriad possessions at her Bel Air home  from her countless furs and many negligees to the famous La Peregrina pearl necklace, a gift from Richard Burton. Opies all-access pass was honored even after Taylor died in the middle of the art project. I was there the day Christies staff came in with shopping bags to take it all away, the photographer recalls. And while the sale earned Taylors estate a whopping $183.5 million, Opies exclusive window into the actresss world  the images will eventually be published as a book  is priceless. See the interactive slideshow

title: In Alabama, a Model for Obamas Push to Expand Preschool
description: President Obamas call in his State of the Union address to make high-quality preschool available to every single child in America rallied advocates across the country who have long argued that inequity in education begins at a very young age.

title: Having Dosas? Then Drink Champagne, of Course!
description: When it comes to finding the perfect glass of wine to go with French, Italian or American cuisine, the options are endless. Finding the ideal match for Indian food, however, is more complicated.

title: A New Commission: Time to Cheer or Yawn?
description: The fate of the Class Act, which would have established the nations first voluntary public long-term care insurance program, was sealed in 2011 when the Obama administration shut it down, essentially calling it unworkable.

title: Horse Meat Found in British Food
description: Britons are unsure what to expect next on the dinner table.

title: Hanging of Militant Raises Questions in India
description: In my latest column in the International Herald Tribune, I argue that the Indian justice system, which includes shoddy police investigations and the powerful influence of political calculations, is not competent nor fair enough to grant India the moral right to hang a man, assuming that any society can have such a right in the first place.

title: Cruise Lines Woes Are Far From Over as Ship Makes Port
description: MOBILE, Ala.  Thousands of hungry and unwashed passengers gathered on the decks of the lifeless Triumph cruise ship, singing Sweet Home Alabama, waving towels and cheering as the vessel was pulled into dock here late on Thursday. For 4,200 passengers and crew, the fetid ordeal of five days adrift in the Gulf of Mexico was over.

title: When Small Businesses Try to Attract Big Partners
description: Small-business owners often maximize their resources and extend their reach by teaming up with larger organizations. But to partner with a larger organization, they first have to get through to one. Alexandra Mayzler, who owns Thinking Caps Tutoring, is trying to do just that. She talked about the challenges of getting a foot in the door at the last She Owns It business group meeting.

title: Life, Interrupted: Crazy, Unsexy Cancer Tips
description: Every few weeks I host a girls night at my apartment in Lower Manhattan with a group of friends who are at various stages in their cancer treatments. Everyone brings something to eat and drink, and we sit around my living room talking to one another about subjects both heavy and light, ranging from post-chemo hair styling tips, fears of relapse or funny anecdotes about a recent hospital visit. But one topic that doesnt come up as often as you might think  particularly at a gathering of women in their early 20s and 30s  is sex.

title: Tip of the Week: Adjusting Facebook Photo Previews
description: Hate the way Facebook seems to arbitrarily crop photos you post on your Timeline to fit the square preview windows? On the desktop version, you can change which part of the picture shows in the preview when youre using Facebook through your Web browser.

title: The Best Beers of Winter
description: Maybe you also went through that phase. The one when you kept an eye on an ominous bucket in a dark corner of your kitchen until the time came to invite over friends, tap it and drink it. Maybe your friends also gulped it, smiled stiffly and said something like, Its . . . interesting. And maybe they also grimaced as if they had just sucked down a rotten egg. I didnt blame them. The brown ale I concocted during my brief foray into home brewing was dreadful stuff  syrupy, unbalanced and weird.

title: Such a Chowder!
description: Russ & Daughters, which has been located at 179 East Houston Street on the Lower East Side of Manhattan since 1923, is what is known as an appetizing store. Appetizing is a noun. It denotes the prepared foods, most often served cold  smoked salmon, herring in sauce, whitefish salad, caviar, cream cheese  that can accompany every public gathering in the life of a Jew living in New York City, from bris to shiva, as Niki Russ Federman, one of the owners, puts it.

title: Glimpses of Jean Arps World
description: CLAMART, France The street is typical French suburbia, gray and peaceful, a far stretch from the narrow sidewalks, rooftops and, in the early 20th century, the artists studios of Montmartre, but only a few kilometers from Paris. Yet, in the 1930s, up this steep and curvy stretch, lived two members of the avant-garde  Jean Arp and Sophie Taeuber. Joan Mir, Max Ernst, Marcel Duchamp and James Joyce were among their visitors.

title: Japans Central Bank Defends Policy on the Yen
description: TOKYO  The recent monetary push by Japan does not amount to currency manipulation and is a legitimate and much-needed effort to lift its economy out of deflation, the countrys central banker said on Thursday after new figures showed an unexpected economic contraction in the fourth quarter.

title: Malaysians Encircle Militia Intruders From Philippines
description: MANILA  The police in Malaysia were in a standoff late Thursday with at least 80 militiamen from the Philippines who were seeking to stay by right of historic claims on the island of Borneo, the police said.

title: 2 Airlines Announce Merger
description: American Airlines and US Airways announced on Thursday that they planned to merge in an $11 billion deal. Under the terms of the deal, US Airways shareholders would own 28 percent of the combined airline, with the remainder held by stakeholders, creditors, labor unions and employees of AMR, the parent company of American. The merger would create the nations biggest airline, in position to compete against United Airlines and Delta Air Lines, which have grown through mergers of their own.

title: Opinion Report: Currency War
description: From the editorial page

title: Builders Travel to Asia to Court Buyers for New London Homes
description: HONG KONG  Wanted: deep-pocketed Asian investors for fledgling London property developments.

title: Immersion Politics: Being Ann Richards
description: LOS ANGELES  The sun was setting in the Hollywood Hills as Holland Taylor whisked a visitor into a front room of her home, a window overlooking the public garden across the street. Golden in the fading light, the den was overflowing with stacks of videotapes, dusty transcripts, books and photographs.

title: The Boy With the Golden Touch
description: The designer behind J. W. Anderson has leapfrogged to the forefront of Londons fashion scene by challenging notions of masculine and feminine dressing, aligning himself with industry powerhouses and keeping his eye on the international prize.

title: Faith, Loss, Luck and Tragedy at the Kumbh Mela
description: ALLAHABAD, Uttar PradeshThe sun rose on Leader Road, Allahabad, which leads to Allahabad Junction Railway Station, warming up a chilly Monday morning. Several local men had already begun to prepare generous shares of potato curry and puris to offer to Kumbh Mela pilgrims free of cost. As I stood at the corner of the street holding an early morning newspaper that reported on the stampede that had killed 36 people the previous night, a short, frail woman meekly approached me.

title: Bracing for a New England Trawling Decision
description: In late December, the New England Fisheries Management Council, a body made up largely of commercial fishermen, voted to recommend that bottom trawling and dredging be allowed to resume in more than half of the protected waters that currently shelter New Englands recovering groundfish stocks. The issue now goes up to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: Thursday Reading: Using Your Phone as a Personal Translator
Berkshire and 3G Capital in a $23 Billion Deal for Heinz
description: 8:56 p.m. | Updated

title: Horse Meat Scandal: Is the Era of Cheap Food Over?
description: LONDON  With Europes expanding horse meat scandal escalating from a drama to a crisis, consumers are being warned that the era of cheap food may be over.

title: More Marcoeconomics
description: No, thats not a misspelling of macroeconomics.

title: G.M.s Profit Rises Despite Weakness in Europe
description: DETROIT  General Motors said its profit in the fourth quarter increased slightly as continued losses in Europe offset positive results in North America.

title: As Troops Leave, an Uncertain Future for U.S. Aid in Afghanistan
description: It has given most of Afghanistan access to health care for the first time, even if it is weighed down by corruption and waste. It has drawn violent reprisals from the Taliban but educated a generation of Afghan girls. Accused of fostering a dependency culture, it has nonetheless provided the foundation for a functioning economy.

title: A Valentine Sandwich Board
description: Dear Diary:Some people wear their heart on their sleeve; one subway passenger wore his on a cardboard sign over his winter coat.

title: A Farewell, Whispered and Roared
description: Maurice Sendak (1928-2012) cultivated an image as a curmudgeon. Im not Hans Christian Andersen, he told Bill Moyers. No ones going to make a statue in the park with a lot of scrambling kids climbing up me. I wont have it.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Time Warner Considers Shedding Some Magazines and Panera Appeals to Consumers Decency
description: Time Warner is in talks with the Meredith Corporation to spin off much of Time Inc., the countrys largest magazine empire and the foundation on which the $49 billion media conglomerate was built, Amy Chozick and Michael J. de la Merced write. The deal would move the bulk of Time Inc.s magazines, including titles like People, InStyle and Real Simple, into a separate, publicly traded company that would include Meredith publications like Better Homes and Gardens and Ladies Home Journal. The new company would borrow money to pay a one-time dividend of about $1.75 billion to Time Warner, making the transaction resemble a sale. Time Warner would continue to control the newsmagazines Time, Sports Illustrated, Fortune and the magazine Money. The deal is one of several options under consideration to reduce Time Warners troubled publishing unit.

title: The Kids Are Alright
description: Via Brad DeLong, I see that Nick Eberstadt has written more about Americas moral collapse. Eberstadt, readers may recall, was responsible for the nation of takers meme that did so much to ensure victory for  Barack Obama.

title: Daily Report: In High-Tech Japan, the Fax Machines Roll On
description: Japan is renowned for its robots and bullet trains, and has some of the worlds fastest broadband networks. But Martin Fackler reports that the country also remains firmly wedded to a pre-Internet technology  the fax machine  that in most other developed nations has joined answering machines, eight-tracks and cassette tapes in the dustbin of outmoded technologies.

title: Dont You Be My Valentine
description: LONDON  While much of the world celebrates Valentines Day on Thursday, Pakistans religious political parties are exhorting the countrys youth to celebrate a day of modesty instead. On Tuesday, the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami, a major religious party, condemned Valentines Day in Peshawar for encouraging immodesty and threatened to shut down any celebrations if law enforcement agencies failed to take action first.

title: David Leonhardt, Washington Bureau Chief, Answers Readers Questions
description: David Leonhardt, Washington bureau chief for The New York Times, answered readers questions on Thursday about the economic landscape and President Obamas prospects to enact the ambitious legislative agenda he laid out in his State of the Union address.

title: Model-Morphosis | Bette Franke at Derek Lam

title: The Most Important Problem Facing Small Businesses
description: For years industry groups have complained that government regulations and taxes were at the root of the weak recovery, but survey data consistently showed that demand was actually far and away the biggest problem. Until recently.

title: The Gun Report: February 14, 2013
description: Here is our sampling of gun violence for February 13:

title: Britain Says Equine Drug May Have Entered Food Chain
description: PARIS  The scandal over horse meat in the European food chain widened Thursday from a case of mislabeling to one of food safety as public health authorities in Britain said that a powerful equine painkiller, potentially harmful to human health, may have entered the food chain in France.

title: The Brazilians Behind the Heinz Deal
description: Warren E. Buffetts $23 billion acquisition of H. J. Heinz, a quintessentially American company, is almost a caricature of a Buffett acquisition.

title: Keystone Protests Resume, But None Against Oil Imports from Nigeria?
description: Ive got nothing against the passions of those  including friends of mine  pushing hard to persuade President Obama not to let the Keystone XL pipeline move forward and carry bitumen from Canadian deposits to United States Gulf Coast refineries. More were arrested this week.

title: The Air That Kills in India
description: The thick haze of outdoor air pollution common in India today is the nations fifth-largest killer, after high blood pressure, indoor air pollution (mainly from cooking fires), smoking and poor nutrition, according to a new analysis presented in New Delhi by the Boston-based Health Effects Institute. In 2010, outdoor air pollution contributed to over 620,000 premature deaths in India, up from 100,000 in 2000.

title: Confessions of a Domestic Gigolo
description: A romantic Valentines is close. Like, broom-closet close. All you need for a sexy good time is a bucket of cleaning supplies and maybe a notary public  depending on how litigious you are. My wife and I are horrible at paperwork, so we struck our deal with a handshake. It was a dubious-sounding pact that went on to revolutionize our marriage: sex for cleaning.

title: Five Questions for: Author Uday Prakash
description: Uday Prakash is an award-winning poet and writer who has published more than 20 books in Hindi. His most recent book The Walls of Delhi, originally written in Hindi, was a finalist for this years DSC Prize for South Asian Literature. His writings have been translated into several languages including Urdu, English, German and Japanese.

title: Record Label Apologizes for Lil Waynes Obscene Reference to Emmett Till
description: Epic Records has offered its regrets and said it would go to great efforts to pull down an online version of a widely criticized track on which the rapper Lil Wayne makes an obscene analogy involving Emmett Till, whose murder was a crucial incident in fomenting the civil rights movement.

title: Poetry Pairing | What Isnt Mine
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing matches What Isnt Mine, a poem by Jill Alexander Essbaum, with A Bond Forged in Crucible of the Art World by Michael Winerip.

title: Bonded by Motherhood and Workplaces
description: Suppose you wrote a new play. Its only your second, but its got a great part for an actress who can win over the audience to a character who can be unsympathetic, someone who can convey existential malaise at the same time as tough-day-at-work frustration.

title: Studio in the Woods
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: For a Character Lost at Sea, an Expert Who Knew the Feeling
description: David Magees day job, abridging books for audio versions, turned out to be pretty good preparation for screenwriting: hes an Oscar nominee and a contender, this weekend, for a Writers Guild Award for his adaptation of Yann Martels allegorical novel Life of Pi. But Mr. Magee needed more than that experience when it came to his title character, a boy lost at sea with only a menacing tiger for company.

title: Its Hard to Find a Hero
description: Even in a sports world that reminds us daily of its heroes flaws, of the dangers of dialing into the television-fueled myth machine, the news that the Olympic sprinter Oscar Pistorius is being charged with murdering his girlfriend in South Africa was still the kind of headline that makes you blink and shake your head to make sure you read it right.

title: What Were Reading
description: Wired: In praise of blue milk and Yodas funky fireside stew: as part of a cover package in the magazine, Alton Brown looks at the food of Star Wars.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Conservatives Skeptical of Expanding Preschool
description: ATLANTA  President Obamas plan to expand preschool for the nations children faces deep skepticism among Republicans, who fear the creation of another federal entitlement program that they say could add to the nations deficit and swell the ranks of the teachers unions.

title: Approve Caitlin Halligan for the D.C. Circuit Today
description: The D.C. Circuit now officially has four vacancies out of 11 seats, as a result of another judge taking senior status this week. Imagine the U.S. Senate with 36 empty seats, which would be the equivalent. We can be quite confident that the Senate would address the problem expeditiously.

title: With Heinz Deal, an Elephant for Berkshire
description: When Berkshire Hathaway agreed to buy the H.J. Heinz Company on Thursday, the deal had some of the classic hallmarks of Warren E. Buffett.

title: A Warm Croon Wrapped in an Enigma
description: Everyone loves a good a mystery  even music journalists. Early last year they got one, when a band called Rhye began posting recordings on the Internet. Information about Rhye was scarce; the groups singles arrived online with alluring promotional photographs  a womans bare back, a womans bare torso  and meticulously produced videos, but no images of the musicians themselves.

title: Pope Says He Will Be Hidden to the World in Retirement
description: VATICAN CITY  Saying he would soon be hidden to the world, Pope Benedict XVI took his leave of parish priests and clergy members of the Diocese of Rome on Thursday as he offered personal, and incisive, recollections of the Second Vatican Council, the gathering of bishops 50 years ago that set the Roman Catholic Churchs course for the future.

title: A Nose for Prose

title: Whats the State of Your Block in 2013?
description: At noon today, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg delivered his final State of the City address.

title: Karen Russell: By the Book
description: The author of Vampires in the Lemon Grove recently met Louise Erdrich, but all she could say was something like Hey, Louise, are these pimentos in the dip?

title: New Center Hosts a Food Conference
description: Some big players in urban food policy  including the New York City Council speaker, Christine Quinn; Newarks mayor, Cory Booker; and the Manhattan borough president, Scott Stringer  will debate the issues at a conference today at 11:15 a.m. The conference is the inaugural event for the new Laurie M. Tisch Center for Food, Education and Policy at Teachers College, a graduate division of Columbia University.

title: More Fun With the Filibuster
description: The attempted-derailing of the nomination process for the two most important national security posts in the government, which started with petulant time-wasting, has mushroomed into yet another Republican-created checks-and-balances crisis.

title: Rivera Shines on His First Day, but Cervelli Is Shadowed by Suspicion
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The juxtaposition of emotions was striking.

title: Ronald Dworkin, Scholar of the Law, Is Dead at 81
description: Ronald Dworkin, a legal philosopher and public intellectual of bracingly liberal views who insisted that morality is the touchstone of constitutional interpretation, died on Thursday in London. He was 81.

title: Time Inc., the Unwanted Party Guest Being Pushed Out the Door
description: 12:43 p.m. | Updated How toxic have print assets become? This toxic: Media companies have begun to quarantine them.

title: A Trans-Atlantic Trade Pact
description: Analyzing the impact of a free-trade agreement between the United States and the European Union.

title: Fund-Raising for Schools, Using Old Class Photos
description: Remember that class photo from second grade that went missing  the one in which you are smiling, without any front teeth? Wouldnt you like to have another copy of it?

title: Lady Gaga Cancels Tour Because of Hip Injury
description: Lady Gaga has torn soft tissues in her hip joint and the injury has forced her to cancel the rest of her Born This Way Ball tour to have surgery and recover, Live Nation Global Touring announced Wednesday.

title: Image of the Day: Feb. 14
Paging Belmondo, or a Horse
description: Can you believe Anna Sui, of all people, is a latecomer to the genre of Nouvelle Vague cinema? She only recently got around to watching the 1960s films of Jean-Luc Godard, but when Ms. Sui dives into a subject, she immerses herself completely.

title: American and US Airways Frequent Fliers: Relax.
description: Dear frequent fliers, your miles are safe  for now.

title: Foundation Says It Regrets Payment to Disgraced Journalist
description: The Knight Foundation says that it regrets paying a $20,000 honorarium to Jonah Lehrer, the disgraced journalist whose appearance at a Knight conference in Miami on Tuesday drew sharp criticism on Twitter and elsewhere.

title: Digital Artists Behind Life of Pi
description: Melena Ryzik pays a visit to Rhythm & Hues, the production studio that created the Oscar-nominated visual effects for Life of Pi.

title: Afraid to Speak Up to Medical Power
description: The slender, weather-beaten, elderly Polish immigrant had been diagnosed with lung cancer nearly a year earlier and was receiving chemotherapy as part of a clinical trial. I was a surgical consultant, called in to help control the fluid that kept accumulating in his lungs.

title: Heres Sally Field, Star of Linkin Park
description: Zach Galifianakis is back with Part 2 of his Oscar edition of Between Two Ferns, and it contains perhaps the best interview youll ever see with Sally Field (star, of course, of Linkin Park), Jessica Chastain ( Zero Dark Thirty, is that a movie about Chris Brown?) and a memorable appearance by Bradley Cooper, Mr. Galifianakiss co-star in The Hangover franchise, the next installment of which could take a slightly darker, plant-hating turn. See it here.

title: Airline Consolidation Continues
description: The deregulation of the airline industry in 1978 led to a wave of mergers that continues to this day. In the latest, American Airlines and U.S. Airways have agreed to merge and would become the largest airline in terms of total passengers flown this year.

title: Model Diary | Jamie Bochert
description: Jamie Bochert, the downtown chic model often considered by industry insiders to be Marc Jacobss muse, has hometown advantage for New York Fashion Week. For the last day of shows, T asked the dark-eyed beauty, 34, a little about her life here off the runway. She doesnt tweet or Instagram; but if she did, she may have told you that she is in tonights Marc Jacobs show, which was originally scheduled for Monday but got postponed due to inclement weather.

title: Video: Mayor Bloombergs Final State of the City Address
description: Watch Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs final State of the City address, delivered Thursday from the Barclays Center in Brooklyn. Watch the speech here.

title: One Hundred Times Forever Dusty
description: The musical Forever Dusty celebrated its 100th performance at New World Stages on Wednesday night. Audience members were invited to sing along with the performers, led by Kirsten Holly Smith as Dusty Springfield. The shows producers said that the first 10 fans to arrive dressed as the singer would receive free admission.

title: Chrysler Is Recalling 278,000 Pickups and S.U.V.s
description: Chrysler is recalling about 278,000 pickups and sport utility vehicles because the rear differential could fail, causing the driver to lose control, according to a report posted on Thursday on the Web site of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Former BlackBerry C.E.O. Sold All Company Shares
description: Jim Balsillie, the former co-chief executive and co-chairman of BlackBerry, has sold all of his shares in the struggling company, a regulatory filing indicated on Thursday.

title: Cardinal Health Is Buying Large Medical Supplier for $2 Billion
description: Cardinal Health, the second-largest distributor of prescription drugs, announced on Thursday that it was buying a large medical supplier in a $2 billion deal aimed at expanding the business into the growing area of home health care.

title: Creating the Nation's Largest Airline
description: With a merger, American Airlines ends a yearlong courtship of US Airways.

title: Referee Played Music in His Funeral Parade
description: No one loves the soccer referee. In fact, he is universally hated. A humorless actor, he is jeered and insulted in all corners of the globe.

title: TimesCast: Creating the Nations Largest Airline
description: Ending a yearlong courtship by US Airways, American Airlines agreed to merge with the smaller carrier, paving the way for the creation of the nations largest airline.

title: John Kerry Potential Winner in Heinz Deal
description: The $23 billion takeover of H.J. Heinz on Thursday featured a familiar cast of characters save for one unlikely victor: Secretary of State John Kerry.

title: In My 2013 Win-a-Trip Contest, We Have a Winner!
description: Im delighted to announce that my 2013 win-a-trip contest winner is Erin Luhmann, a Minnesotan who is now a straight-A graduate student of journalism at University of Wisconsin in Madison. Erin earlier studied English at Gustavus Adolphus College, in St. Peter, Minn., and then spent two years teaching English in the Peace Corps in Kyrgyzstan in central Asia  which, as she pointed out in her application, means she wont have a problem with whatever toilets we encounter. Erin is a lovely writer, blogger and video producer who plans on a career as a foreign correspondent, ultimately aspiring to help train overseas journalists to reach a global audience. Shes deeply committed to amplify overseas voices and encourage Americans to engage with important global news stories. Shes also a hard worker: When I called her up with the news that she had won, she immediately asked for a reading list and inquired whether she should start studying French in case we visit a French-speaking country.

title: Could the Kardashians Enter Baku Even If They Really Wanted to?
description: Last weekend, the magazine published my article with the print headline, If They Build It, Will the Kardashians Come? The story, about Bakus ambition to become a new hub for the global 1 percent, focuses on Khazar Islands, a $100 billion megadevelopment being built on the Caspian, and the headline flicks at the developments target audience  celebrities and, mainly, people who want to be celebrities  while touching on the unavoidable globalizing and liberalizing effect this sort of project will have.

title: LIPA Customers Are the Most Dissatisfied in the Country, a Study Says
description: The results of the first survey of utility customers since Hurricane Sandy are in, and they indicate that the New York metropolitan area is a hotbed of dissatisfaction.

title: G.O.P. Blocks Vote in Senate on Hagel for Defense Post
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans on Thursday blocked President Obamas nominee to lead the Pentagon in a defiant move likely to further strain partisan tensions while preventing the White House, at least temporarily, from assembling its second-term national security team.

title: Photos of The Moment | Proenza Schouler
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: No, but They Play One Onstage
description: Greg Keller was trying to pay Maria Dizzia a compliment, and she was having none of it.

title: The M Bar at the Mansfield Hotel
description: Sometimes an O.K. bar will do.

title: Graphic: The 10 Biggest Food Deals
description: The food industry has long been a fertile area for deal activity. Companies that can offer well-known brands and strong steady cash flows are attractive to both strategic buyers and private equity firms. Food, along with tobacco, was at the heart of one of the fiercest corporate takeover battles  the fight for RJR Nabisco, as famously chronicled in Barbarians at the Gate.

title: Hands-on Cooking Lessons
description: There are 72 hours worth of videos uploaded to YouTube every minute,  writes our colleague Kate Murphy, much of it cringe-worthy. In her article, she breaks down what makes a video go viral and what doesnt work.

title: The Adrenaline-Fueled Life of Oscar Pistorius
Ahoy, Ralph Lauren
description: The S.S. Ralph Lauren pulled into port this morning on the final day of New York Fashion Week, depositing enough peacoats, admiral coats, passementerie, sailor pants and fisherman sweaters on his runway to make you think it was Fleet Week, not Fashion Week. In other words, there was a light nautical theme to the collection, along with an assortment of beaded gowns and velvet dresses in dark mossy tones.

title: Heinz: A Bonanza for Independent Advisers
description: The sale of H.J. Heinz to Berkshire Hathaway and 3G Capital is big in many ways  the headline price of $23 billion, for one. But one notable fact is that most of the banks putting the deal together arent bulge-bracket firms.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New, Starring Chelsea Handler and Oscar de la Renta
description: A dual review of whats new: Chelsea Handler and Oscar de la Renta sound off on Nikes new featherweight sneaker, the perfect egg recipe, 2013s hottest color and more.

title: Hotel and Carrier Meet Cute
description: Delta and Starwood have paired up  their loyalty programs, that is. The Crossover Rewards program offers a number of perks starting March 1. Among them: Gold-tier members of Starwoods loyalty program get points for every dollar spent on a Delta flight; members of Deltas frequent-flier program receive miles for every dollar spent at a Starwood hotel, in addition to miles earned in flight. Starwoods brands include standbys like Westin and Sheraton as well as the W hotels, Aloft and Meridien.

title: On Beauty | The Naked Face
description: Tina Turnbow demonstrates how to create a flawless and natural look.

title: Justice Department Approves Random House-Penguin Merger
description: The merger of Penguin and Random House cleared a big hurdle Thursday.

title: New York Philharmonic Names Principal Clarinetist
description: The New York Philharmonics solution is now the Chicago Symphonys problem. The Philharmonic addressed its four-season lack of a principal clarinetist by hiring Stephen Williamson away from the Chicago Symphony, the orchestra disclosed on Thursday. Mr. Williamson was one of the first appointments made under the watch of Chicagos music director, Riccardo Muti, and is in the middle of only his second season there. Chicago will now have to find a replacement, although a Chicago Orchestra spokeswoman said Mr. Williamson officially was on a one-year leave.

title: Photos of The Moment | Reed Krakoff
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Ralph Lauren: Fall 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: From Bloomberg, a Warning of Life After Bloomberg
description: In an unabashed and relentless tribute to his own municipal stewardship, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg on Thursday declared victory over 12 years of obstructionists and naysayers who sought to block his vision for New York City, and warned that an era of political independence might leave City Hall when he did.

title: Mother Water, Fish Water
description: If youve been following the tale of our family quest down the Mekong River, this thought may have occurred to you: traveling long days in a small boat with two children is not a dream vacation. This thought also occurred to me  quite regularly around midnight during many sleepless nights before our departure.

title: A Laboratory for Revitalizing Catholicism
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  At one new megachurch in So Paulo, a Roman Catholic priest who was a personal trainer before joining the clergy energetically belts out songs, rock-star style, before 25,000 worshipers. Other Brazilian priests are donning cowboy hats and crooning country tunes at Mass or writing best-selling advice tomes emblazoned with heartthrob photographs on the cover.

title: Video: Digitally Creating the Meerkats (and Tigers) of Pi
description: Three years were spent working on the 3D effects in Life of Pi, and, given his top billing, youd think much of that was spent on the tiger, Richard Parker. But the ocean turned out to be a much more demanding star; the constantly shifting waves and whitecaps presented many more challenges to the effects wizards at Rhythm & Hues. They worked with the director Ang Lee to give the ocean moods  hopeful, or melancholy, or operatically dramatic. In this video, Bill Westenhofer, the movies visual effects supervisor, explains how they amped up or scaled back their creations, and why the scenes with meerkats were a highlight of the project.

title: Now Hear This: Library of Congress Issues Plan to Preserve Recordings
description: If you listen to music, the state of recorded sound may strike you as healthy and robust. Whether you hear it in a club, on the radio, on mp3, compact disc or LP, and whether the recording was made last week or decades ago, the sound is solid and the experience can be immersive.

title: The Two Julias
description: On Feb. 11, 1863, Maj. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant faced a challenge more urgent than capturing Vicksburg, Miss., his current military objective. This morning I met with a great loss, he wrote his wife Julia from temporary quarters aboard the steamer Magnolia, anchored near the Mississippi River town. Last night, contrary to my usual habit, I took out my teeth and put them in the wash and covered them with water. This morning the servant who attends to my stateroom, blacks my boots, &c. came into my room about daylight and finding water in the basin threw it out in to the river, teeth and all. Grant thought his dentist, a Dr. Hamline, might be in Memphis, and since Julia was there, Grant urged her to try to find him and tell him of my misfortune.

title: Track Star Charged in Killing
description: Michael Sokolove, a writer who profiled Oscar Pistorius, discusses the dark turn for the South African runner.

title: Gaming the System
description: Inside Higher Ed had a fascinating article a couple days ago about some college students who unanimously boycotted their final exam and all got As under a grading curve loophole. Its a great example of game theory at work.

title: The President Revives an Old Debate About Privacy
description: Few expect Internet privacy legislation in Congress this year. But many were heartened that the p word came up at all in the State of Union address Tuesday night.

title: Detropia and Sword Dancing
description: Many see Detroit as a supreme symbol of the Rust Belt, to which the recession delivered a merciless coup de grce, but if theres an American city whose cultural contributions are more underrated, the Miser would love to know about it.

title: Now Streaming | Calvin Klein Fall 2013 Womens Collection
description: The Fall 2013 womens collection from Michael Kors at New York Fashion Week.

title: A New Chef at the Beatrice Inn
description: The Beatrice Inn, Graydon Carters latest West Village restaurant, has hired Hillary Sterling as its executive chef, replacing Brian Nasworthy, who recently left. Ms. Sterling worked at Mesa Grill and Lupa, and was chef de cuisine at A Voce.

title: No Ice or Skates, but There Are Goals
description: TANAHEY PARK, nestled between the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges on the Lower East Side, is a gathering spot for skateboarders and basketball players. On weekends, even during the winter, street-hockey players sweep in with a clatter.

title: Philadelphia Orchestra to Record for Deutsche Grammophon
description: Ah, a conductor with benefits. Riding the train called Yannick Nzet-Sguin, the Philadelphia Orchestra said it will release its first recording on a major label in 16 years, on Deutsche Grammophon. Mr. Nzet-Sguin is the orchestras new music director, a rising star in the conducting world who has been recording for Deutsche Grammophon since 2008.

title: Surrounded by Love All Day
description: Loving ones work is always important, but especially so when that work involves being in constant contact with people who are in love. It helps, too, that James Mitchell, who officiates at more than 200 weddings a week at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau, is happily married himself.

title: The F.D.A. Approves a Bionic Eye
description: The Argus II allows Barbara Campbell, who lost her sight 20 years ago, to see the world through patterns of light. Scientists hope it is the beginning of even more treatments.

title: For CNN, Cruise Ship Coverage by Air, Land and Sea
description: There are a number of ways to get ahead in the cable news world. One way is partisan talk about the news, as exemplified by shows on MSNBC and Fox News. Another way is personality-based  think Bill OReilly, Joe Scarborough and Rachel Maddow.

title: Device Offers Partial Vision for the Blind
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved the first treatment to give limited vision to people who are blind, involving a technology called the artificial retina.

title: Manhattan of the Mind
description: If New York were a blank slate, how would you fill it in?

title: Leagues Action Reduces Acting
description: Quirks of the Game is a regular feature on the Times sports blogs.

title: Traces of Anxiety Drug May Affect Behavior in Fish
description: Traces of a common psychiatric medication that winds up in rivers and streams may affect fish behavior and feeding patterns, according to a study in the journal Science published Thursday.

title: Parish Hall
description: Inside a restaurant focusing on regional Northeast cuisine in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Conflicting Assertions Over an Electric Car Test Drive
description: 6:10 p.m. | Updated Let me get this out of the way up front: This blog post will not be the definitive word on the contentious subject of a Times article in Sundays Automobiles section. Its just an early effort to put some claims and counterclaims out there, while I continue to look into it.

title: Speech Aside, the State of the City Was Poppin
description: Updated, 3:46 p.m. | A teenagers ode to lip gloss. A song whose lyrics include Down in Jamaica we give it to you hot like a sauna. A dash of M.C. Hammer, with a hint of Vanilla Ice. And perhaps the least subtle of Marvin Gayes myriad paeans to passionate embrace.

title: A Modern Setting With Rustic Aspirations
description: The walls are padded and white in the immaculate back dining room of Parish Hall, which calls to mind a sanitarium run by Shakers. All is subdued: the lights, the maple surfaces, the waiters footfalls across concrete floors, the conversations at tables set diplomatically apart.

title: Starter: Old Hollywood Glamour at Harlow
description: Starter, an occasional column, takes a look at newly opened restaurants.What, then, are some reasons diners might consider venturing to the Upper East Side to visit the new Harlow restaurant, which had its glittery opening at a Fashion Week-timed gala Wednesday night?

title: Merck Settles Suits Over Cholesterol Drug
description: Merck has agreed to pay $688 million to settle lawsuits claiming that it had harmed investors by delaying the release of unfavorable study results for its cholesterol drug Vytorin, the company announced on Thursday.

title: The Motherlode Blogroll Needs Blogs
description: I love blogs.

title: In Heinz Takeover, a New Path for Deals
description: Heinz ketchup is giving markets a taste of private equitys new secret sauce.

title: Judge Accepts Transocean Guilty Plea in Gulf Oil Spill
description: HOUSTON  A federal judge in New Orleans approved on Thursday Transoceans agreement with prosecutors to plead guilty to a misdemeanor charge and pay $400 million in criminal penalties for its role in the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil well blowout that left 11 workers dead and resulted in a yearlong moratorium on deepwater drilling.

title: Russia Seeks the Arrest of a Politician From Georgia
description: MOSCOW  Russian authorities issued an arrest warrant for a Georgian politician, Givi Targamadze, on Thursday, charging that he had incited riots in Russia, in particular by helping to organize an antigovernment march last May that culminated in a confrontation between protesters and the riot police.

title: Front Row | Michael Kors
description: Celebrities and fashion editors alike graced the front row of Michael Kors fall collection for women at Lincoln Center on Wednesday. See interactive feature >>

title: Fashion Week Parties, Night 7
description: Cosmo toasts its March cover girl, gents strut at Gramercy Park Park, and Pharmacy is held at the Hudson.

title: East Asian Physical Traits Linked to 35,000-Year-Old Mutation
description: Gaining a deep insight into human evolution, researchers have identified a mutation in a critical human gene as the source of several distinctive traits that make East Asians different from other races.

title: Best Dunk and 3-Point Specialists? No Contest
description: Keeping Score is a regular feature on the Times sports blogs.

title: To Help Light Up Africa, Many Drops in the Bucket
description: By visiting Web sites like Kickstarter and Indiegogo, you can give money to any number of causes. These Web sites collect small amounts from many individuals in what is known as crowdfunding to finance everything from business start-ups to charitable causes to art projects.

title: For Alabama, a Recruiting Title
description: Just weeks after winning its second consecutive national championship  and the third in four seasons  Alabama won the 2013 recruiting title, at least according to the sites ESPN.com, Rivals.com and 247Sports.

title: Dispersing Steichens Across the Country
description: Eight years ago the Los Angeles financier Richard Hollander and his wife, Jackie, bought more than 500 Edward Steichen photographs directly from his estate. And in one fell swoop the Hollanders became known for having what experts say is the worlds largest private collection of Steichen works. Their holdings cover all periods  the celebrity and fashion images, the early landscapes and city scenes, the fantastical ads  and each image was printed by Steichen himself, which makes the collection highly coveted.

title: 36 Hours in Melbourne, Australia
description: The fact that Melbourne, the capital of the Australian state of Victoria, regularly appears near the top of lists ranking the worlds most livable cities says a lot about its efficiency, cleanliness and safety. What that recognition doesnt immediately reveal is how Melbourne is now arguably the most exciting city for food Down Under  something the annual Melbourne Food and Wine Festival (melbournefoodandwine.com.au), running March 1 to 17 this year, should help highlight. But even more noteworthy is the citys distinctive creative energy, manifested everywhere, from flourishing street art and a cool bar scene to homegrown boutiques and buzzing back-street cafes. When even cosmopolitan Sydney talks of Melbournising, its clear that something special is happening in Ozs second city.

title: Melbourne, From Art to Vinyl
description: On a trip around the Australian city, shop boutiques, browse museums and even grab a drink in the middle of a river.

title: Teaching Orwell and 1984 With The Times
description: The famous 1984 Apple Macintosh commercial, which ran during that years Super Bowl.

title: The Great Refrainer
description: This past December the Claremont Institute convened a forum at the Ronald Reagan Building in Washington to discuss the presidential election. The mood among the conservative stalwarts during the reception may have ranged from pensive to glum, but it brightened somewhat when Claremonts panelists contemplated a return to true Republican principles as advanced by the last president to slash both taxes and the federal budget  Calvin Coolidge. James Ceaser, a political scientist at the University of Virginia and a regular contributor to The Weekly Standard, said it was important to revive the moral stigma of debt, and added, I want to go back to Coolidge and even McKinley. The Claremont fellow Charles Kesler, author of I Am the Change, a recent book denouncing President Obama and liberalism, agreed: Were in for a Coolidge revival.

title: Transforming a Once-Seedy Stretch of Venice, Calif.
description: In this bohemian Los Angeles enclave, boutiques, design stores and even a curiosity or two are popping up along Rose Avenue.

title: A Random Gift of Coffee Makes My Day
description: It may be Valentines Day, but this morning still felt like most mornings do at my house  that is, like a fire drill.

title: Vows | Master of Ceremonies
description: James Mitchells officiant style is a mix of 19th-century orator and hopeless romantic. In three years at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau, Mr. Mitchell has performed over 27,000 ceremonies.

description: To the Editor:

title: Stay in School
description: To the Editor:

title: A Writer Pops Up
description: To the Editor:

title: Head First
description: To the Editor:

title: Debt-Ridden Maryland Buys Every Athlete an iPad
description: At first blush, the news item that Maryland has announced plans to buy an iPad for every one of its roughly 500 athletes at a cost of about $300,000 seems like just another case of temporary insanity caused by the recruiting arms races.

title: Slavery and Development
description: To the Editor:

title: This Be the Verse-Novel
description: To the Editor:

title: Threes a Trend | The Berry Lip
description: A deeply stained lip smacks with film-noir-like allure and Park Avenue polish: 3.1 Phillip Lim presented an option for every woman; Vera Wang kept it modern with a clean face and flowing tresses; and Oscar de la Renta had his girls recall golden-era Hollywood starlets with slicked hair and chandelier earrings.

title: How Lightning Tightens Apples Control Over Accessories
description: When the iPhone 5 was released in September with the new Lightning connection port, all those docks and accessories that longtime Apple customers had been collecting for years were suddenly obsolete. But Lightning-compatible accessories have been trickling in more slowly than the typical flood of Apple accessories that comes after a new iPhone release. Why?

title: Can You Capture the Soul of Your Business in a Photo?
description: Introducing the Small Picture.

title: Lautenberg, Oldest Member of Senate, Wont Run Again
description: Facing a fight for his seat from within his own party, Senator Frank R. Lautenberg of New Jersey said Thursday that he will retire rather than seek a sixth term next year.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Government Malware and Education Disruption
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Love Conquers All, Except the Partisan Divide
description: A new Fox News poll has found that when Americans look for someone to share Valentines Day with, odds are they are not casting their eyes across the political aisle.

title: $5 Million Gift to Aid Juilliard Program for Minority Students
description: The Juilliard School said on Thursday that it had been promised a $5 million gift that will go a long way toward guaranteeing the survival of music lessons for poor minority schoolchildren. The money comes courtesy of a former journalist turned venture capitalist, Michael Moritz, and his wife, Harriet Heyman, a writer.

title: Fat Dad: Baking for Love
description: My grandmother Beauty always told me that the way to a mans heart was through his stomach, and by the look of pure delight on my dads face when he ate a piece of warm, homemade chocolate cake, or bit into a just-baked crispy cookie, I grew to believe this was true. I had no doubt that when the time came, and I liked a boy, that a batch of my gooey, rich, chocolatey brownies would cast him under a magic spell, and we would live happily ever.

title: Europe Rejects Critics of Robin Hood Tax
description: BRUSSELS  European regulators on Thursday defended plans to create the first international tax on financial transactions after business groups in the United States warned that the levy could break international agreements.

title: Weighing Down Heinz With Debt
description: Warren E. Buffett deployed his avuncular charm on Thursday when talking about Berkshire Hathaways proposed acquisition of H.J. Heinz. The food companys chief executive, William R. Johnson, said the deal was a natural next step that wouldnt lead to big upheavals any time soon.

title: When Calvin Klein Met Glen Plaid
description: As the dark, dark, fall collections enter their home stretch, and even with the big Marc Jacobs show still to come tonight, we may as well go ahead and declare a winner as Fashion Weeks MVT. (That is, Most Valuable Trend.)

title: Syrian Rebels Claim Near Control of a Key Province
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian insurgency claimed on Thursday to have near-total control of a strategically important province in the countrys northeast, home to some of the few remaining domestic oil production facilities that supply fuel for President Bashar al-Assads military forces, after ferocious clashes that lasted for three days.

title: Oscar Pistorius, the Blade Runner in Repose
description: Pieter Hugo, whose photographs accompanied Michael Sokoloves profile of the South African runner Oscar Pistorius last year, shared with us these outtakes from his photo shoot. Hugo recently photographed the South African businessman and politician Cyril Ramaphosa for the magazine.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Q. and A. With Diane Kendal
description: The British-born, Brooklyn-based makeup artist is the go-to pro for many of New Yorks hottest young designers including Jason Wu, Thakoon and Alexander Wang.
