Government peace negotiators reacted angrily to the officers capture and the FARC quickly promised to release them. The FARC and the government began talks last fall to end their nearly 50-year war. Also on Friday, another rebel group, the National Liberation Army, or ELN, released five mining company contractors it kidnapped last month, said the International Committee of the Red Cross, which assisted with the release. In a Twitter post President Juan Manuel Santos criticized the ELN for not also releasing a Canadian captive.

title: Off Reggaes Grid, Back on the Map
description: In Rastafarian culture, Babylon symbolizes the corruption of Western society. Bob Marley sang of its oppressions; the Melodians wept by its rivers. But for Watty Burnett, a Jamaican reggae musician who recorded with Mr. Marley, these days Babylon is just a Long Island town nine miles down the road.

title: IHT Quick Read: Feb. 16
description: NEWS Around 1,200 Russians were injured after a meteor hit the atmosphere, and residents of Chelyabinsk were left to deal with memories that seemed to belong in science fiction. The scenes from Chelyabinsk, rocked by an intense shock wave when a meteor hit the Earths atmosphere Friday morning, offer a glimpse of an apocalyptic scenario that many have walked through mentally, and Hollywood has popularized, but scientists say has never before injured so many people.  Ellen Barry and Andrew E. Kramer report from Moscow.

title: U.S. Embassy Denies Intervening in Mexico Cabinet Choice
description: The United States Embassy in Mexico on Friday issued a statement denying an article in The New York Times that reported that Ambassador Anthony Wayne had met with senior Mexican officials to discuss American concerns about the possible appointment of Gen. Moiss Garca Ochoa of Mexico as that countrys defense secretary.

title: Online Battle Over Sacred Scrolls, Real-World Consequences
description: There is a saying about academia that the disputes are so vicious because the stakes are so low. In the case of Raphael Haim Golb, a son of a Dead Sea Scrolls scholar, the last few years have provided ample support for the first half of the saying. But the second half is less accurate.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 9:50 P.M. (Encore) WATERWORLD (1995) Dry land is a myth! Or so they say in this post-apocalyptic action film, in which the oceans seemingly cover the entire planet, and the last vestiges of humanity struggle for survival. Kevin Costner is the Mariner, an enigmatic misanthrope who nonetheless becomes the protector of a child (Tina Majorino, above with Mr. Costner and Jeanne Tripplehorn) who could lead the way to dry land, if he can fend off the Deacon (Dennis Hopper) and his army of jet-ski-driving commandos. Writing in The New York Times, Janet Maslin said that the film was a big, brawny, overzealously bizarre epic punctuated by daring action scenes, which are sloppily assembled (the sky or ocean color seldom matches in any two consecutive scenes) but still exciting.

title: The Weekend Word: Unravel
description: Todays Times

title: Black and White, and Blue
description: We highly recommend viewing this slideshow in full-screen mode.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: A week-long curfew in the Kashmir Valley that was imposed after the execution of the militant Muhammad Afzal was lifted Saturday, NDTV reported. Supporters of Mr. Afzal, who hailed from the Sopore town of Baramulla district, believed that he received an unfair trial for his role in the deadly Parliament attack case of 2001. Internet and television services have been restored in Kashmir after having been shut down, the report said.

title: How Much Do You Trust Journalists?
description: LONDON  Another poll came out this week showing that in the hierarchy of trust, journalists figure near the bottom of the heap.

title: The Guide to London Fashion Week
description: As the shows kick off in the English capital, T reveals where to stay, eat and party.

title: Gratifying Signs of Desperation
description: On both sides of the Atlantic, the austerians seem to be freaking out. And that has to be good news, an indication that they realize, at some level, that theyre losing the debate.

title: Should Common Plastics Be Labeled Toxic?
description: THE HAGUE  Hoping to reduce one of the most ubiquitous forms of waste, a global group of scientists is proposing that certain types of plastic be labeled hazardous.

title: Photos of The Moment | Sass & Bide
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Grace Notes
description: Ladylike elegance feels provocatively alluring right now. See the interactive.

title: Group of 20 Vows to Let Markets Set Currency Values
description: MOSCOW  In a concerted move to quiet fears of a so-called currency war, finance officials from the worlds largest industrial and emerging economies expressed their commitment on Saturday to market-determined exchange rate systems and exchange rate flexibility.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Berlin Film Festival: Wong Kar-wai, Kung Fu Auteur
description: BERLIN  This years Berlin International Film Festival had one of its flashiest opening-night films in some time with The Grandmaster, the eagerly anticipated new movie from the Hong Kong director Wong Kar-wai.

title: New Era for U.S. Womens Team
description: In the first United States womens national team games of 2013, four players got their first caps, during which time we also celebrated Abby Wambachs 200th. Jane Campbell, 17, got her first call-up and trained alongside Christie Rampone, 37, who has been a part of the team since Campbell was a toddler. Sydney Leroux and Whitney Engen got their first starts, and Christen Press scored three goals in her first two national team appearances.

title: Singhs Case Puts Shortcomings of Tours Antidoping Program at Forefront
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, Calif.  On the 11th tee box at Riviera Country Club, Vijay Singh was waiting to hit Friday when a spectator shouted, Deer hunter!

title: The Nassau Coliseum Starts Its Long Goodbye
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  To enter Nassau Coliseum is to step back in time. It has been the Islanders home since their inception in 1972 and retains the intimacy of an Original Six rink.

title: Prospect Eager to Hold Tigers Fate in Hands
description: LAKELAND, Fla.  The minor leaguers of the Detroit Tigers mostly stay in a dormitory on the Tiger Town campus at spring training. It is a short walk from the major league clubhouse at Joker Marchant Stadium, but most of the Tigers can go through their workday without ever seeing it.

title: Renewed Push for Afghans to Make Peace With Taliban
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Suddenly, the effort to strike a deal with the Taliban is very publicly back on the front burner.

title: The Future of Sprint Cup Waits to Take the Next Step
description: Ricky Stenhouse Jr. wears a cowboy hat and western boots and dates Danica Patrick. So even before he straps in for the Daytona 500 next Sunday, the first race of his rookie season in the Sprint Cup series, he already stands out in the Nascar garage.

title: Can Rivals Hatred Become Teammates Amity? Its Happened
description: The pinstriped teammate treaty between Kevin Youkilis, the Yankees new third baseman and former Red Sox star, and Joba Chamberlain, once suspended for firing two fastballs over Youkiliss head, evolved from a kindergarten spat compared with what went on between Carl Furillo and his longtime tormentor, the New York Giants right-hander Sal Maglie, before they suddenly became teammates on the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1956.

title: Karzai to Ban Afghan Forces From Requesting Foreign Airstrikes
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai said Saturday that he would issue a decree forbidding his military forces from turning to NATO or American forces to conduct airstrikes, and he condemned the use of torture on detainees by his security forces.

title: Keiko Fukuda, a Trailblazer in Judo, Dies at 99
description: Keiko Fukuda, who learned judo from its inventor and went on to become the sports highest-ranked woman, died on Feb. 9 at her home in San Francisco. She was 99.

title: In Chicago, Especially, Jordan Still Reigns Supreme
description: CHICAGO  Michael Jordans 50th birthday falls on Sunday, the day of the 62nd N.B.A. All-Star Game.

title: 17-Year-Old Takes All the Attention in Stride
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S.C.  Jahlil Okafor is a 17-year-old basketball star from Chicago with the bulk to knock opponents down and the explosiveness to jump over them, but he prefers to use a quiver of throwback moves and nimble size 17 feet to whisk around them.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I do enjoy an Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon puzzle, and todays cryptic crossword puzzle was no different. My wavelength was a bit off, so this one was a little harder for me than past Hex cryptics, yet the answers made me laugh.

title: Pope Electors Are Sizing Up a Field of Peers
description: There is no formal nominating process for choosing the man to succeed Pope Benedict XVI, and campaigning for oneself is counterproductive. But the cardinals who will file into the Sistine Chapel next month to elect a new leader of the Roman Catholic Church have been quietly sizing up potential candidates for years.

title: The Mets C.C. Embraces Low Profile
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The best chance for the Mets to add a flashy name to their roster dissolved when Michael Bourn, a two-time All-Star and two-time Gold Glove center fielder, signed with the Cleveland Indians.

title: American, 17, Wins in Slalom and Makes Herself a Favorite in Sochi
description: One day after the American Ted Ligety became the first man in 45 years to win three events at one world championship, his 17-year-old teammate Mikaela Shiffrin became the youngest female world champion in 28 years with a come-from-behind victory in the slalom.

title: Inquiry on Democratic Senator Started With a Partisan Push
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va.  Sandwiched between two doctors offices at a roadside plaza here is the headquarters of a small team of veteran Republican investigators, operating almost as a private detective squad, who since late last year have had a determined goal: bringing down Senator Robert Menendez, Democrat of New Jersey.

title: In Mali, the Peril of Guerrilla War Looms
description: GAO, Mali  Aguissa Ag Badara, a former tour guide, now rides around the city on the back of a motorcycle looking for Islamist militants who may still be lurking about. He even wears a pin to advertise his mission. It reads, Vigilance Brigade: Patrollers of Gao.

title: Explosion in Crowded Market Kills Dozens in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  A devastating explosion ripped through a crowded market in the western city of Quetta on Saturday, killing at least 63 people and wounding at least 180, the police said.

title: After Assault From the Heavens, Russians Search for Clues and Count Blessings
description: CHEBARKUL, Russia  After a brilliant flash illuminated the sky on Friday morning like a second sun, Alyona V. Borchininova and several others in this run-down little town in the Siberian wilderness wandered outside, confused and curious.

title: Age and Size Stand Out, but So Does Talent
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The Downey Christian School varsity basketball team bursts from the locker room in single file, led by a boy 14 inches shorter than the next smallest player, four years younger than the next youngest.

title: Stronger Gun-Control Measures Clear First Votes in the Colorado House
description: DENVER  Lawmakers moved closer on Friday to passing a package of new gun restrictions in Colorado, a state that has lived under the shadow of two of the worst mass shootings in United States history.

title: The 115 Men Who Will Choose the Next Pope
description: Cardinal electors from every region of the world will gather to choose the man to succeed Pope Benedict XVI. See how they add up.

title: California Eases Tone as Latinos Make Gains
description: LOS ANGELES  A generation ago, California voters approved a ballot initiative that was seen as the most anti-immigrant law in the nation. Immigrants who had come to the country illegally would be ineligible to receive prenatal care, and their children would be barred from public schools.

title: Subverted Classics
description: Some of fashions most iconic and feminine staples  demure heels, delicate pearls, evening clutches  have been tweaked for a sexy twist. See the interactive.

title: Nets and Knicks Centers Become 2-Way Threats
description: If the N.B.A. season ended today, the Nets and the Knicks would have home court advantage in the first round of the playoffs. A key component of each teams success is that rare commodity: a 7-footer who can change the game on either end of the floor.

title: The Real Cost of Shrinking Government
description: In less than two weeks, a cleaver known as the sequester will fall on some of the most important functions of the United States government. About $85 billion will be cut from discretionary spending over the next seven months, reducing defense programs by about 8 percent and domestic programs by about 5 percent. Only a few things will be spared, including some basic safety-net benefits like Social Security, as well as pay for enlisted military personnel.

title: The Health Benefits That Cut Your Pay
description: NOT long ago, a 23-year-old woman joined my company as an assistant in the advertising sales department at a starting salary of $35,000. Smart, ambitious and poised, she should have a promising future. Unfortunately, her earnings prospects are threatened. Like many Americans, shes unaware of how much of her compensation is being eaten up by health care costs, and how much this share will grow as long as the increase in health costs exceeds growth in gross domestic product. Thats just math.

title: Sunday Dialogue: U.S. Policy Toward Russia
description: Readers react to Gary Harts urging of patient diplomacy.

title: The Oscar for Best Fabrication
description: WASHINGTON

title: Vast Throng in Bangladesh Protests Killing of Activist
description: NEW DELHI  Tens of thousands of people resumed mass demonstrations in Bangladeshs capital on Saturday, intensifying their demands for more severe punishment for war criminals from the countrys 1971 liberation war, while also demanding justice for the slaying of a blogger who had been a leading organizer of the protests.

title: The End of a Catholic Moment
description: THE last time the Chair of St. Peter stood vacant, during Pope John Paul IIs funeral in 2005, the Roman Catholic Church enjoyed a wave of unusually favorable coverage from the American press. The Polish pope had a way of disarming even his most stringent critics, and that power extended beyond his death, turning his funeral into a made-for-television spectacle that almost felt like an infomercial for the Catholic faith.

title: Leonid Tishkov
description: Leonid Tishkov is a Moscow physician turned avant-garde artist. His latest project, Private Moon, is a series of stylized and sentimental photographs of himself with a large illuminated crescent moon taken at various locations around the world.

title: The Gun Report: Wayne LaPierre Edition
description: Earlier this week, Wayne LaPierre, the executive vice president of the National Rifle Association, wrote a remarkable editorial for The Daily Caller entitled Stand and Fight, filled with the kind of paranoia and fear-mongering that he has become so well known for. My assistant, Jennifer Mascia, and I decided it would be a useful exercise to annotate it, a kind of fact-checking exercise for our readers. The Gun Report will return Monday morning with its usual round-up of gun violence.

title: Syrians Freed in Abductions That Stoked Fears of More Strife
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The tit-for-tat kidnappings of more than 140 people have provoked fears of expanded sectarian conflict in Syrias northern Idlib Province in recent days, but one set of hostages was released in good condition on Saturday after negotiations between residents of two of the affected villages, according to a rebel commander.

title: Dreadful, Dreadful Arsenal
description: Will eight seasons without a trophy be enough for Arsenal to send Manager Arsne Wenger and his full-length bubble down coat packing?

title: Al Qaedas AARP?
description: Travelers younger than 12 years old and older than 75 no longer have to take off their shoes to pass through airport security.

title: Fascination Lingers for Three Stars of Warriors Brief Run
description: In the late 1980s, the Bay Area was a thriving sports scene. The San Francisco 49ers won back-to-back Super Bowls and the Oakland Athletics appeared in three consecutive World Series, winning one.

title: How to Unparalyze Us
description: I WAS struck by one particular moment during President Obamas State of the Union address. The president proposed a $1 billion investment to build a new National Network for Manufacturing Innovation to spur high-tech manufacturing in America. Im sure that would be helpful, and Im sure the president will have to beg to get any such funding out of Congress. Yet sitting up there in the balcony listening to the presidents speech was the chief executive of Apple, Tim Cook. Apple is currently sitting on $137 billion of cash in the bank. There are many reasons Apple has not spent its cash hoard, but Ill bet anything that one of them is the uncertain economic and tax environment in this country. Think about how much better wed all be if Apple, and the many other companies sitting on cash, felt confident enough in the future to spend it. These are the most dynamic companies in the world. They dont need any government help to innovate.

title: My Life With Boxes
description: I HAVE Dumpster dived. I have walked my dog, pretending he is just looking for a place to pee, on trash night, to see what treasures people have left curbside. I have a great chair (circa Somerville, Mass., 1978), which cost me a fortune to reupholster, that the dog did not pee on and that I did get into the trunk of my car. Pride? Now Id worry about bedbugs, but in my idealistic youth, I just wanted free furniture.

title: The Queen of the West
description: At 19 years old, Charles Rivers Ellet was one of the Union Armys youngest colonels. In a Feb. 2, 1863 report, Rear Adm. David Porter characterized him as  the kind of man I like to command, a gallant and daring officer who will undertake anything I wish him to without asking questions. But, Porter added, The only trouble I have is to hold him in and keep him out of danger. That same day, Porter had ordered the Queen of the West, a steam-powered wooden ram under Ellets command, south past the Confederate batteries at Vicksburg to reconnoiter the lower Red River and destroy any Confederate ships he encountered.

title: How Europe Bankrolls Terror
description: BOSTON

title: Retirement: Scarier Than Freddy Krueger
description: IM used to horror. Im the father of Freddy Krueger, for Petes sake. But the horror of retirement? I didnt see that one coming at all.

title: Bus Strike Put Damper on Field Trip Attractions
description: At the New York Hall of Science in Queens, the button-operated skateboard that children use to test their balance has been sitting still for most of the week.

title: Equal Opportunity, Our National Myth
description: President Obamas second Inaugural Address used soaring language to reaffirm Americas commitment to the dream of equality of opportunity: We are true to our creed when a little girl born into the bleakest poverty knows that she has the same chance to succeed as anybody else, because she is an American; she is free, and she is equal, not just in the eyes of God but also in our own.

title: Soriano Begins to Settle In With Nationals
description: VIERA, Fla.  It was a few minutes before nine on Saturday when Rafael Soriano stepped into his new spring training clubhouse, passport issues resolved and many save opportunities for the Washington Nationals ahead.

title: Some Chinese Are Souring on Being North Koreas Best Friend
description: YANJI CITY, China  Beds shook and teacups clattered in this town bordering North Korea, less than 100 miles from the site where the North said it detonated a nuclear test that exploded midmorning in the midst of Chinese New Year festivities.

title: The Slugfest in the Executive Suite
description: ATLANTIC CITY

title: Minimum Wage Economics
description: Im doing this kind of backwards, writing about the politics first. But I wanted to have my intellectual ducks  or rather, my lucky duckies  in a row before taking on the economics. And while I was grubbing around, Mike Konczal produced the perfect post summing it all up.

title: Dont Blink, or Youll Miss Another Bailout
description: MANY people became rightfully upset about bailouts given to big banks during the mortgage crisis. But it turns out that they are still going on, if more quietly, through the back door.

title: In Colorado, a Step on Gun Regulation
description: Lawmakers moved closer to passing a package of new restrictions, in a state that has lived in the shadows of two mass shootings.

title: Why Gender Equality Stalled
description: THIS week is the 50th anniversary of the publication of Betty Friedans international best seller, The Feminine Mystique, which has been widely credited with igniting the womens movement of the 1960s. Readers who return to this feminist classic today are often puzzled by the absence of concrete political proposals to change the status of women. But The Feminine Mystique had the impact it did because it focused on transforming womens personal consciousness.

title: The Essay, an Exercise in Doubt
description: I am an essayist, for better or worse. I dont suppose many young people dream of becoming essayists. Even as nerdy and bookish a child as I was fantasized about entering the lists of fiction and poetry, those more glamorous, noble genres on which Nobels, Pulitzers and National Book Awards are annually bestowed. So if Freud was right in saying that we can be truly happy only when our childhood ambitions are fulfilled, then I must be content to be merely content.

title: Where Ice Lights a Fire in the Economy
description: The ice fishing scene in Minnesota has been more lively this year, thanks to more snow and colder temperatures.

title: Seeing Double, and Triple, at Yankees Camp
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The old line that you cant tell the players without a scorecard is even more prevalent at this years Yankees camp. To be safe, you might need two.

title: In the Quest for Love, Costs vs. Benefits
description: IS love for sale? Maybe not quite as directly as sex is, but economists believe that the quest for a romantic partner obeys essentially the same cost-benefit logic that governs every other market.

title: So Why Are You at Your Desk on a Sunday?
description: This interview with  Daniel T. Hendrix, president and C.E.O. of Interface Inc., a designer and maker of carpet tile, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Photos of The Moment | Sister by Sibling
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Jumping Aboard the Train, as if There Wont Be Another
description: THE economy may be lurching into another crisis, but you wouldnt know it from the stock market, where an epic party is under way.

title: Problems in a Wealth Tax
description: To the Editor:

title: Many Economists Are Immigrants, Too
description: To the Editor:

title: A Penny for Your E-Mail
description: To the Editor:

title: Popular Restaurant Is Hit by Bomb in Somali Capital
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  A bomb ripped through a popular seafood restaurant on Saturday at a beach that is perhaps the greatest symbol of Mogadishus recent renaissance, with witnesses and the police reporting that a Somali soldier had been killed and up to three other people wounded.

title: If Youre Collecting Our Data, You Ought to Protect It
description: LAST summer, employees at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration received an in-house newsletter illustrated with mock front pages of USA Today and The Washington Post and seemingly hyperbolic headlines like: NASA Laptop Stolen, Potential Compromise of 10,000 Employees Private Information!

title: Cabernet and Jerky, in the Same Sentence
description: IF you think of beef jerky as a last-resort protein to be bought at a gas station, Jon Sebastiani wants to change your mind.

title: When Youve Had One Meeting Too Many
description: HAVE you started holding meetings in the office restroom?

title: All the Planets in a Row
description: I WAS born in Cuba, and I was 2 when my parents brought me to the United States in 1962 with my baby brother, Jorge.

title: Sabathia and Rivera Pass Another Test
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The most notable Yankee pitchers coming off surgery, C. C. Sabathia (left elbow) and Mariano Rivera (right knee), each threw about 30 pitches in bullpen sessions on Saturday. It was Sabathias first time on a mound since Dr. James Andrews removed a bone spur arthroscopically last Oct. 26.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Feb. 17
description: President Obama hit the road last week to promote the proposals he unveiled during his State of the Union address.His chief of staff, Denis McDonough, will appear on three of the Sunday talk shows to discuss the obstacles facing Mr. Obamas second-term agenda.

title: N.B.A. Players Dismiss Union Leader
description: HOUSTON  Billy Hunter was fired as executive director of the N.B.A. players union on Saturday, with a bold, decisive vote and a public rebuke.

title: 30 Seconds With Greg Anthony
description: A year after winning a national championship at Nevada-Las Vegas, Greg Anthony was the Knicks first-round draft choice in 1991, and he became a spark plug on their defense. He played with five other N.B.A. teams before retiring in 2002.

title: A Difficult Path for an Education
description: Wu Yiebing and Cao Weiping have made huge sacrifices to improve their childs education, as millions of other Chinese families have done.

title: Mark My Words
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Now this was a neat one, even if I do seem to have an issue with my built-in rebus detector. For those just tuning in, yes, this technically counts as a rebus. A rebus is anything other than a single letter per square, so numbers or odd characters like todays punctuation marks count. And then, of course, we have the Down entries, which is a whole other ball of punctuation marks.

title: In China, Families Bet It All on College for Their Children
description: HANJING, China  Wu Yiebing has been going down coal shafts practically every workday of his life, wrestling an electric drill for $500 a month in the choking dust of claustrophobic tunnels, with one goal in mind: paying for his daughters education.

title: Thomas Tait: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Woman, 19, Dies After Seeking Refuge in Apartment Lobby
description: A 19-year-old woman died early Saturday morning in the East Village after seeking shelter in the lobby of an apartment house, the police said.

title: Development Grant Sales Are Brisk in Los Angeles
description: Last year, Malibu, Calif., was one of several thousand communities across the country that received federal grants intended to improve the lot of low- and moderate-income residents. But instead of putting the $54,866 it received to work on an eligible project, like restoring houses, the city did what dozens of other well-off municipalities have done: it sold its grants to other communities in exchange for smaller purses that had no strings attached.

title: When Elite Tournaments Were Rare and Noteworthy
description: Tournaments that bring together the best players at the same place at the same time became possible only in the jet age. There are now so many elite tournaments that few of them are actually memorable.

title: The White House Continues Working on Immigration Legislation of Its Own
description: WASHINGTON  The White House is working on early drafts of a comprehensive bill that would offer 11 million illegal immigrants a pathway to citizenship along the lines of the principles that the president laid out in Las Vegas several weeks ago, administration officials said.

title: Left to Right, Capitals Ovechkin Has a New Angle
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  Alex Ovechkin wore gray as he took line rushes at practice here Saturday. Gray is the color designated for the Capitals second line.

title: In Awe of Star Playing Partners, Beljan Goes On to Beat Them
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, Calif.  Charlie Beljan checked his pinging smartphone Friday night, and his heart started pounding when he read the text message informing him of his third-round pairing at the Northern Trust Open. Beljan, a one-time PGA Tour winner who was playing on third-tier tours two years ago, was in a group with Phil Mickelson and Ernie Els, who have a combined 60 tour victories, including eight majors.

title: Leading After Three Rounds, Haas Aims for a Repeat and a Milestone
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, Calif.  Trying to carve your own niche in golf when your great-uncle is the 1968 Masters champion and your father is a nine-time PGA Tour winner can be an exercise in futility, like trying to whittle a piece of wood using a plastic knife.

title: Ayatollah Says Iran Will Control Nuclear Aims
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader said Saturday that his country was not seeking nuclear weapons but added that if Iran ever decided to build them, no global power could stop it.

title: Big Talent, Tiny Point Guard
description: Julian Newman is a 70-pound, 4-foot-5 fifth grader who plays varsity basketball with high schoolers at Downey Christian School in Orlando, Fla.

title: Barnaby Conrad, Man of Many Hats and a Cape, Dies at 90
description: As a 19-year-old art student one summer in Mexico City, Barnaby Conrad attended a bullfight, and, with a whimsical bolt of Hemingwayesque bravado, leapt into the ring and challenged a bull himself, using his Brooks Brothers raincoat as a cape.

title: UConn Denies Rutgerss Stringer Her 900th Win
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J.  C. Vivian Stringers 900th victory  and the new contract she seeks to extend her 18-year tenure at Rutgers  must wait.

title: Thinking Beyond the Creationists and the Darwinists
description: The directions to the rural North Texas home of Jim Marrs, an author and conspiracy researcher, certainly sound like something from an old episode of The X-Files: Go north about seven miles, and watch for a sign on a green metal gate at the top of a steep hill.

title: Officials Speeding Fine Builds to Lurid Scandal
description: LONDON  It began mundanely enough, with a speeding violation 10 years ago.

title: Small Shift in Numbers Gives House Democrats a Fresh Shot at Relevance
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for The Tribune.

title: Starting New Businesses Behind Bars Creates an Incentive for Texas Inmates
description: CLEVELAND  As Christopher Holbert danced down the aisle of a Cleveland Correctional Center classroom, dozens of other prisoners in matching dark blue uniforms flanked him, clapping and cheering. When he reached the front of the classroom, he spoke for 10 minutes on his business plan for Adrenaline Indoor Paintball, an idea he worked on over the last year.

title: Waiting for Cloud to Lift on State Cancer Institute
description: When Texas voters approved the creation of the $3 billion Cancer Prevention and Research Institute of Texas in 2007, state officials said they hoped it would help Texas become an epicenter of cancer research, accelerate the development of lifesaving treatments and expand prevention programs.

title: As Families Change, Koreas Elderly Are Turning to Suicide
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Even with the explosive growth of suicides in South Korea, the case of the 78-year-old widow was shocking enough to merit attention in the recent presidential election and hand-wringing in the news media.

title: New York Is Likely to Get 2015 All-Star Game
description: HOUSTON  The N.B.A. All-Star Game is returning to New York in 2015, to a borough yet to be determined.

title: Staten Island Rapper Says Police Misinterpreted Drugs Video
description: Earlier this week, the New York police arrested 32 people on charges of selling prescription drugs, other types of drugs and guns on Staten Island.

title: Vindication for Entrepreneurs Watching Sky: Yes, It Can Fall
description: For decades, scientists have been on the lookout for killer objects from outer space that could devastate the planet. But warnings that they lacked the tools to detect the most serious threats were largely ignored, even as skeptics mocked the worriers as Chicken Littles.

title: Tavares Lifts Isles With Words and 3 More Goals
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  John Tavares sat at his locker not appearing at all weary after carrying the Islanders on Saturday night.

title: Colleges Become Major Front in Fight Over Carrying Guns
description: BOULDER, Colo.  Public colleges and universities have become a major front in the nations debate over guns as gun-rights advocates press to expand the right to carry concealed weapons, a campaign that gained steam after the 2007 shooting rampage at Virginia Tech, which left 33 people dead. And though guns remain banned from most state colleges, pro-gun forces, in a series of high-decibel legal and political battles, have made inroads on the issue in a handful of states, most recently Colorado.

title: Lottery Numbers
Cuomo Bucks Tide With Bill to Ease Limits on Abortion
description: ALBANY  Bucking a trend in which states have been seeking to restrict abortion, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is putting the finishing touches on legislation that would guarantee women in New York the right to late-term abortions when their health is in danger or the fetus is not viable.

title: A Gentler Tortorella May Coach the U.S. in the Olympics
description: If the N.H.L. continues to make progress in talks with Olympic officials aimed at sending its players to the 2014 Games in Sochi, Russia, one big question looms. Who would coach the United States team?

title: For 16-Year-Old at Millrose, Another Race, Another Record
description: The crush of youngsters who surrounded Mary Cain after she broke her own national record could have been confused with the groupies who mob teen idols. Many of them snapped photographs with her and asked for her autograph even though she was about their age.

title: Missing Karlsson, Senators Are Shut Out
description: TORONTO  Life without defenseman Erik Karlsson began Saturday for the Ottawa Senators as they fell to the Toronto Maple Leafs, 3-0.

title: Lindsey Lozmack, Robert Nelson III
description: Lindsey Kathryn Lozmack and Robert Curtis Nelson III were married Saturday at the Shrine of St. Joseph in St. Louis. The Rev. Dale Wunderlich, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Sandra Marks, Adam Fagen
description: Sandra Lynn Marks and Adam Paul Fagen are to be married Sunday at Temple Sinai in Washington. Rabbi Gerald Sussman, the grooms maternal uncle, is to officiate.

title: Elizabeth Gottshall, Mark Mannion
description: Elizabeth Rush Gottshall, a daughter of Susan Hogg Gottshall and Thomas Rush Gottshall of Columbia, S.C., was married Saturday to Mark Robert Mannion, a son of Maryanne Armenti Mannion and Dr. John Dana Mannion of Camden, Del. The Rev. Dr. J. Richard De Witt, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the First (Scots) Presbyterian Church in Charleston, S.C.

title: Monica Herrera, Alexander Damashek
description: Monica Herrera and Alexander Maiorano Damashek are to be married Sunday at Punto de Vista, a villa in Manuel Antonio, Costa Rica. Rolando Mora Madrigal, a cousin of the bride and a notary public, is to officiate, and Eduardo Wilson, a friend of the brides father, is to assist. The ceremony, in English and Spanish, will be nondenominational but will include Roman Catholic and Jewish rituals.

title: Jessica Zimmerman and Jonathan Graf
description: Raindrops Can Melt a Heart

title: Melissa OShea and Mark Fitzsimmons
description: Volunteering Has Its Rewards

title: Kaylan Scagliola and Evan Moitoso
description: Kaylan Marie Scagliola and Evan Matthew Moitoso were married Saturday at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York. The Rev. Frank Nash, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Allison Chanin, Paul Gorbaty
description: Allison Linn Chanin and Paul Gorbaty are to be married Sunday at Cedar Hill Golf and Country Club in Livingston, N.J. Rabbi David J. Nesson is to officiate, with Cantor Maimon Attias taking part.

title: Evania Taveras, Alan Shukovsky
description: He Lost a Card Game, but Really Won

title: Christina Grasso and Christopher Wilcox
description: Christina Marie Grasso, a daughter of Cheryl A. Grasso and Steven R. Grasso of South Kingstown, R.I., was married Saturday evening to Christopher James Wilcox, a son of Louise M. Wilcox and Paul M. Wilcox of Cumberland, R.I. The Rev. J. Michael Egan, a Universal Life minister, led a nondenominational ceremony incorporating Christian elements at the Providence Biltmore Hotel in Providence, R.I.

title: Farryl Rosenberg, Joshua Silver
description: Farryl Starr Rosenberg and Joshua Samuel Silver are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Jonathan Berkun at the Aventura Turnberry Jewish Center in Aventura, Fla.

title: Jaclyn Senior and Howie Brown
description: Jaclyn Marie Senior and Howie Brown were married Saturday at Old St. Josephs Church in Philadelphia. The Rev. Timothy C. Senior, an auxiliary bishop of the Archdiocese of Philadelphia and an uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony. The Rev. Ryan J. Maher, a Roman Catholic priest, took part.

title: Susan Garrigle and Hugh Mallaney
description: Susan Chadwick Garrigle, the daughter of Rosalind Chadwick Garrigle and William Aloysius Garrigle of Moorestown, N.J., is to be married Sunday to Hugh James Mallaney, the son of Michael J. Mallaney of Chicago. The Rev. Robert Quinn, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony at SS. Agatha and James Church in Philadelphia.

title: Gila Shlomo, Avi Sutton
description: With a Mothers Prodding, a Match

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, Feb. 17
description: People are reluctant to speak about themselves. So you go to a friend and say, Can you tell me about cardinal so-and-so?

title: In Show Before Show, a Raptor Dunks Best, and Two Knicks Fall Short
description: HOUSTON  For so long, James White has wanted to put on a show for the basketball world. He waited to hear the roar of the fans over a spectacular dunk in the N.B.A.s annual dunk contest.

title: In Singapores Immigration Debate, Sign of Asias Slipping Middle Class?
description: BEIJING  Immigration is a hot-button issue nearly everywhere in the world, though the contours of the debate vary from place to place. In the United States, sweeping changes to the law may offer legal residency for millions of people who have entered the country illegally, my colleague Ashley Parker reports.

title: Corrections: February 17, 2013
description: NEW YORK

title: San Jose Says Goodbye to a Beloved Tournament
description: Two of the tallest and hardest-serving players in tennis headlined the SAP Open in San Jose this week, but the story line that rose above John Isner, Milos Raonic and all others was the departure of this event after 125 years in the Bay Area.

title: Americas Pullout from Afghanistan
description: In his 2013 State of the Union address, President Obama announced his decision to remove 34,000 American troops from Afghanistan by the end of February 2014.

title: Blasts in Baghdads Shiite Neighborhoods Kill 21
description: BAGHDAD  A wave of attacks in Shiite neighborhoods in Baghdad killed at least 21 people and wounded 125 on Sunday, a security official said.

title: Verratti: Heir to Italys Playmaking Throne
description: Paris St.-Germain took a star-studded lineup to the Mestalla to face Valencia in their Round of 16 Champions League match last Tuesday. The former Serie A stars Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Ezequiel Lavezzi and Javier Pastore tormented the Spanish teams defense throughout a 2-1 victory. It was another player, however, one who formerly plied his trade in Italy, that caught many eyes.

title: Preen: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Shiite Protesters Demand Arrests After Deadly Bombing in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Hundreds of Shiite women staged a sit-in in the western city of Quetta on Sunday evening to mourn the 84 people who were killed in an explosion a day earlier in a crowded market there, and they demanded that the government arrest the attackers.

title: French Publishers Forge Deal With Google, Breaking Ranks With Europe
description: PARIS  Publishers in France say they have struck an innovative agreement with Google on the use of their content online. Their counterparts elsewhere in Europe, however, say the French gave in too easily to the Internet giant.

title: Eagerly Awaiting Release of Brazilian Evangelicals Autobiography
description: The crowds of young people began arriving in SoHo in the dark, pitching portable chairs and passing cups of porridge among them. By 3:30 on Saturday morning, more than 200 were waiting. As they huddled together along Prince Street, an early morning drizzle turned the pavement to glitter.

title: Stanley and the Crazies
description: Dylan Matthews has an interesting piece suggesting that Stan Fischer might become our next Fed chairman. Fischer would indeed be highly qualified (as would Janet Yellen or Christy Romer, to name two other obvious candidates). But Matthews also suggests that Fischer might have a leg up in the confirmation process, because he has been a highly successful governor of the Bank of Israel who worked well with Netanyahu.

title: Obamas Plan Sees 8-Year Wait for Illegal Immigrants
description: WASHINGTON  A plan by President Obama for an overhaul of the immigration system would put illegal immigrants on a path to citizenship that could begin after about eight years and would require them to go to the back of the line behind legal applicants, according to a draft of the legislation that the White House has circulated in the administration.

title: LWren Scott: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Berlin Film Festival: Romanian Film Takes Top Prize
description: 10:46 a.m. | Updated

title: Disruptions: On the Fast Track to Routine 3-D Printing
description: Will the future be printed in 3-D?

title: White House Concerned About Delay in Security Confirmations
description: President Obamas chief of staff said Sunday that the White House had grave concern that national security was at stake, given the Senate Republicans delaying tactics in confirming both a new Pentagon chief and a director of the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Photos of The Moment | Thomas Tait
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Crowds at St. Peters Cry Viva il Papa to Benedict
description: VATICAN CITY  Pope Benedict XVI asked the tens of thousands of people who had flocked to St. Peters Square on Sunday for one of his last public appearances to pray for him and his successor.

title: Bruce Willis Shows Strength at the Box Office
description: Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sylvester Stallone went kersplat in their recent bids for renewed box-office glory, but another 1980s-era star  Bruce Willis  has shown that hes still kicking. A Good Day to Die Hard, starring Mr. Willis in a role he created 25 years ago, was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $25 million. The film, which cost 20th Century Fox about $90 million to make, has sold $33.2 million in tickets since opening on Valentines Day, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box-office data.

title: Small-Town Meteorites
description: A day after pieces of meteorites apparently landed in a lake in the small Russian town of Chebarkul, residents gathered at the shore with a mix of awe and pride.

title: Former Israeli Foreign Minister Pleads Not Guilty in Fraud Case
description: JERUSALEM  Israels tough-talking former foreign minister, Avigdor Lieberman, pleaded not guilty on Sunday to charges of fraud and breach of trust in a criminal case that leaves his political future hanging in the balance.

title: Still Lonely in a World With More Onlies
description: I am surrounded by junior versions of me, only children racing around playgrounds, shoveling scoops of sand into their own individual piles. In the 70s, the era of my childhood, I was a freak in a world of four-child families. Now my time has come, and parents of these onlies often ask how I felt about being an only child. Their children are lovely, well-adjusted parent-pleasers. It is easy to see that sibling or no sibling, they will have happy lives, and that is what I emphasize.

title: A Widower Presses Lifes Reset Button
description: Matt Browne has come prepared for his London vacation  with Viagra, Valium, condoms, mouthwash, a blowup doll and a framed photo of Betty, the wife to whom he was faithful for 38 years. Betty, who looked vaguely like Frances Sternhagen, died six months ago. And Matt (Jack Davidson), the lonely American protagonist of Neil Koenigsbergs Off the Kings Road, is rewarded or punished, depending on your point of view, with an alarming amount of incident.

title: Caught Between Love and Country
description: For gay Americans with foreign spouses or partners, federal restrictions on what defines marriage mean they sometimes end up uprooting their lives to remain together.

title: Hard to Call Anyone a Winner, When Medals Are Lost to Doping
description: It was August 2004. The Athens Olympics were in full roar, and a few of us boarded a bus in the darkness, made the long, overnight ride to the site of the ancient Games in Olympia and reported on a feel-good shot-put competition that turned out  like too many modern competitions  to be a sham.

title: Mary Katrantzou: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Preen by Thornton Bregazzi
description: Delicate punk  is how makeup artist Val Garland described the mood at Preen this morning. Gray powder eye shadow was mixed with water to create a liquid liner, which was drawn in a sharp diagonal line on either the upper or lower lid. Its quite painterly and graphic, explains Garland, who used an artists brush to create the precise look. To emphasize the eyes, the skin, lips, eyebrows and hair were kept muted. Theres a sense of androgyny in the collection. You get the feeling thats shes a bit of a tomboy, says hairstylist Anthony Turner. Turner dampened models hair before drying it with his fingers for a soft, natural effect. LOreal Professionnels Fresh Dust dry shampoo was then spritzed over locks to add texture and a pretty, flyaway finish. So when the girls walk, it almost looks a little static, he says, adding its all very cool and very easy.

title: A Gusher in Edmonton: Oilers Attempt 85 Shots in Rally to Beat Colorado
description: It just goes to show what shooting the puck does. Its pretty cool to be a part of a record, especially being able to set one with this organization, which has some pretty tough records to beat, said Edmontons Ryan Nugent-Hopkins, after the Oilers recorded a team-record 56 shots on goal while attempting an astounding 85 shots.

title: With No Shortcut to a Green Card, Gay Couples Leave U.S.
description: Not long ago, Brandon Perlberg had a growing law practice and a Manhattan apartment he shared with his partner, who is British. They hosted themed dinner parties and wine tastings for a wide circle of friends.

title: From Cutie-Pie to Dame
description: Adorable, peppy, ingratiating and fiercely talented, Kristin Chenoweth embodies the concept of cute more completely than almost any entertainer I can think of. (Well, there was Shirley Temple.) Cuteness is irresistible until its not, and in the past Ms. Chenoweth has occasionally gone too far.

title: Obama and Woods Meet for a Round of Golf
description: JUPITER, Fla.  President Obama and Tiger Woods will both live a dream on Sunday: playing golf together for the first time.

title: Jonathan Saunders: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Dark Nights of the Soul in the Kingdom of the Holy Grail
description: In the stage directions for Act I of Parsifal, set near the sanctuary of the knights of the grail in a mythical region of medieval Spain, Wagner writes that the scene depicts a forest with a deep-set lake in the background. This glade should be shady and solemn, he indicates, but not gloomy (doch nicht dster).

title: At Camp, Jeter Details Challenges Of Recovery
description: TAMPA, Fla.  One of the toughest guys in Yankee Stadium could not bring himself to look.

title: Obama Faces Risks in Pipeline Decision
description: President Obama faces a knotty decision in whether to approve the much-delayed Keystone oil pipeline: a choice between alienating environmental advocates who overwhelmingly supported his candidacy or causing a deep and perhaps lasting rift with Canada.

title: Matthew Williamson: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Photos of The Moment | Mulberry

title: Could Wind Power Cool New Englands Price Fever?
description: As I reported in Saturdays paper, New England is experiencing a remarkable spike in electricity prices brought on by high heating demand and rising natural gas prices for electric generators.

title: Taming the Runaway U.S. Budget
description: WASHINGTON  If Democrats and Republicans cant agree on a deficit reduction plan, in two weeks automatic budget cuts will kick in that could severely weaken the U.S. economy and the American military.

title: Paul Smith: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Strasburg Still Wrestles With Principle That Protected Him
description: VIERA, Fla.

title: Stalking a Most Prolific Phantom
description: The graffiti artist Banksys work is immediately recognizable: clever, funny, sometimes political stencils and artworks that have popped up on walls (and occasionally in museums and galleries) in cities around the world  giant rats clutching paint brushes or umbrellas or boom boxes; chimps wearing placards (Laugh now, but one day well be in charge); trompe loeil windows/holes (opening out onto a mountain vista or a picturesque beach or a pretty cloudscape) on barrier walls in the West Bank; children wearing gas masks or chasing after balloons that are floating away.

title: A Duchess Who Made Blue Blood Curdle
description: The chatter about Powder Her Face, the British composer Thomas Adss 1995 debut opera about a real-life sex scandal among the British aristocracy, generally gravitates toward a single, conspicuous point in the work: an aria that not only accompanies an act of oral sex but simulates it.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The stock and bond markets will be closed on Monday in observance of Washingtons Birthday. The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes the regular weekly auction on Tuesday of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Wednesday.

title: Patrick Earns a Historic Pole, at a Premier Event
description: If there was any question whether Danica Patrick could make an impact in Nascars premier Sprint Cup Series, the answer came Sunday with a performance that put her in the record books.

title: The Junior Camrose in Manchester, England
description: The more events for junior players the better. This years World Youth Open Championship will be held from Aug. 3 to 11 in Atlanta, running alongside the Summer North American Championships.

title: Donovan Will Rejoin Galaxy in March
description: The Los Angeles Galaxy announced on Sunday that midfielder Landon Donovan would return to the club in the final week of March, nearly a month into the regular season.

title: Richard Nicoll: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Ben Folds to Write a Short Musical
description: The Exchange and the 24 Hour Company are to announce on Monday that Ben Folds will write a 15-minute musical that is to be cast, written, rehearsed and performed in a single day as part of the fifth production of The 24-Hour Musicals. The process will begin the evening of April 28 and continue around the clock until a total of four planned musicals are performed at the Gramercy Theater at 8 p.m. on April 29. Other participants have yet to be announced. Tickets are scheduled to go on sale in March, and proceeds will benefit the nonprofit Orchard Project, which helps develop new theater work. Information is at 24hourplays.com.

title: Marios Schwab: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London

title: 2 Lovers, 2 Houses and 2-Handed Squiggles in Old Verona
description: Prokofievs celebrated score for Romeo and Juliet has never sounded better in the theater, in my experience, than at Pacific Northwest Ballets two performances on Saturday at City Center. True, at the matinee a horn cracked briefly during a hard ascent in the Act II wedding scene at Friar Laurences cell, and yet that was one of many passages where you couldnt miss the proud, affectionate and detailed phrasing of the Pacific Northwest Ballet Orchestra. Emil de Cou, conducting both performances, shaped the score superbly.

title: Hafner, Hard-Hitting North Dakotan, Joins Yankees
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The greatest home run hitter born in North Dakota slipped into Yankees camp quietly Wednesday night. It may be surprising to learn that Travis Hafner, the former Cleveland Indians slugger, tops the extremely short list because another left-handed-hitting North Dakotan occupies a cherished place in Yankees lore.

title: A Game Aims to Draw Attention to Womens Issues
description: Social cause gaming, or the use of games to promote awareness of societal problems, has been growing since pioneer online projects like Food Force, the United Nations World Food Programs 2005 game about confronting famine, and Darfur Is Dying, MTVs 2006 offering in which players navigate the terrors of a Sudanese refugee camp.

title: Suez Canal Kept Open in Spite of Egypt Protests
description: CAIRO  Thousands of demonstrators shut down the administrative buildings of the Suez Canal terminal in the city of Port Said on Sunday, as part of a general strike protesting the death sentences handed down three weeks ago to 21 local soccer fans for their roles in a deadly riot last year.

title: High-Pitched Warble
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Im in a quandary (actually, Im in my office, but you know what I mean). I dont believe that the theme for this puzzle works, but I like Jeffrey Harriss puzzles and I like Monday puzzles, so Im going to have to think about the way I want to talk about todays offering. Theres not a lot that is innately wrong with it, but when the theme is quirky it takes most of the fun out of the solve for me. As always, your mileage, etc., etc.

title: Film Feast: Eclectic and Rare
description: The new and the vital brush up against the lovingly exhumed in Film Comment Selects, a strong cinematic sampler that starts Monday at the Film Society of Lincoln Center. Each year the brain trust at Film Comment magazine brings together this diverse, pleasure-driven series mostly made up of work that has recently played on the festival circuit, from Berlin to Toronto. Although some selections, including the opening-night movie (the icky Simon Killer) and closing-night selection (its opposite, The We and the I), have distribution, others have slipped below the radar because they are too eccentric, too tough, too indefinable or sometimes just too good.

title: Searching for Bootstraps for Pulling Up
description: The civil rights movement had the so-called big six, but with the passage of time and the temptation to resort to historical shorthand it sometimes seems as if that club of influential black leaders really had only one member, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Perilous Reminders as War Nears End
description: Its awfully late in the cycle of embedded and ride-along war journalism, the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan having been covered by news organizations and documentarians to the point, some might say, of oversaturation. And the Pentagon is certainly adept at using its gatekeeper ability on such coverage to whip up support for troops and the budgets that support them.

title: Logging Off to Trace a Web Photo to Its Source
description: When photographs of spontaneous events miraculously appear on the Web, it generally prompts two responses: wonder and skepticism.

title: Dog Experts Dos and Donts for Pet Owners in China
description: It has not always been easy for dogs in China. They have been beaten, eaten and, once, were banned in Beijing.

title: Economic Reports for the Week of Feb. 18
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Economic data to be released include the Producer Price Index for January and housing starts for January (Wednesday); and weekly jobless claims, the Consumer Price Index for January, used home sales for January, the Philadelphia Fed index for February and leading economic indicators for January (Thursday).

title: Inquiry Into China Film Trade Unnerves Hollywood
description: LOS ANGELES  Hunkered down. Lawyered up. Looking over your shoulder for the prosecutors.

title: Of Cannibals, Kings and Culture: The Problem of Ethnocentricity
description: In August of 1563, Michel de Montaigne, the famous French essayist, was introduced to three Brazilian cannibals who were visiting Rouen, France, at the invitation of King Charles the Ninth. The three men had never before left Brazil, had just been subjected to a long interrogation by the king (who was 13 years old at the time), and if they had not already contracted some dangerous European illness, they were surely undergoing a rather severe case of culture shock. Despite this, they still had enough poise to lucidly respond to Montaignes questions about what they thought of their new surroundings.

title: Fast & Furious Stresses Social Side of Fandom
description: LOS ANGELES  Despite selling $1.8 billion in tickets, Universals Fast & Furious car-racing series is Hollywoods equivalent of a second-class citizen.

title: New York Parks in Less Affluent Areas Lack Big Gifts
description: Last year, Central Park received what is believed to be the largest gift ever given to an American park, $100 million, from the hedge fund manager John A. Paulson.

title: Bill Eadington, Economist and Gambling Expert, Dies at 67
description: Bill Eadington, an economist who was one of the first academics to study gambling, as both a force for economic development and a challenging social problem, died on Feb. 11 in Crystal Bay, Nev. He was 67.

title: Schools Ask: Gifted or Just Well-Prepared?
description: When the New York City Education Department announced that it was changing part of its admissions exam for its gifted and talented programs last year, in part to combat the influence of test preparation companies, one of those companies posted the news with links to guides and practice tests for the new assessment.

title: In Arduous Officer Course, Women Offer Clues to Their Future in Infantry
description: Last fall, two newly minted female lieutenants joined about 100 men in Quantico, Va., for one of the most grueling experiences that soldiers not in war can experience: the Marine Corps Infantry Officer Course.

title: When a Pope Retires, Is He Still Infallible?
description: VATICAN CITY  What will he be called? Will he keep his white robes and trademark red loafers? And in the last absolute monarchy in the West, how does the dramatic resignation of Benedict XVI, the first pope to step down willingly in six centuries, change a role long considered by the Roman Catholic Church to be that of Gods representative on Earth?

title: Rem Vyakhirev, Former Chief of Gazprom, Dies at 78
description: MOSCOW  Rem I. Vyakhirev, who as chief executive of the huge Russian energy company Gazprom during the 1990s resisted efforts by reformers to break up and privatize it, only to end his tenure a billionaire owning valuable pieces of the company himself, died on Feb. 11. He was 78.

title: Netanyahu Defends Handling of Prisoner X
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday defended his governments handling of an Australian-Israeli who was held under a pseudonym for months in a maximum-security prison until he committed suicide in 2010, suggesting that the threats his country faces justify the extraordinary measures and the secrecy shrouding the case.

title: In Red Sox Camp, the Clouds Part
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.

title: Business Insider Names Executive Editor
description: Business Insider, the online news franchise started by Henry Blodget nearly six years ago, is appointing an executive editor for the first time as it grapples with a good problem: growth.

title: Back in a Swing State, This Time for Sport
description: PALM CITY, Fla.  It was not his motivation, certainly, but President Obama is honoring his modern predecessors on this Presidents Day weekend by doing what many of them liked to do on breaks: chill out in Florida with the guys  including, in his case, one of golfs most famous guys, Tiger Woods.

title: In Russia, Ruins and Property Spared by Meteor, Side by Side
description: CHELYABINSK, Russia  The shock wave from a meteor that exploded above Siberia last week somehow sheared the roof off a brick and steel factory building while leaving a nearby glass facade unscathed.

title: Photo Replay: Feb. 17
description: A view of the day in sports, from snowboarding to mud wrestling.

title: A Matter of Perception
description: IRVINE, Calif.  Virtual reality is one of many inventions that never seemed to make the leap from science fiction to mass-market product.

title: Some Employers Could Opt Out of Insurance Market, Raising Others Costs
description: WASHINGTON  Federal and state officials and consumer advocates have grown worried that companies with relatively young, healthy employees may opt out of the regular health insurance market to avoid the minimum coverage standards in President Obamas sweeping law, a move that could drive up costs for workers at other companies.

title: Tech Industry Sets Its Sights on Gambling
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Look out Las Vegas, here comes FarmVille.

title: Hezbollah Unmasked
description: WASHINGTON

title: To Practice Law, Apprentice First
description: NEWARK

title: The Second-Mortgage Shell Game
description: IN January, federal regulators announced an $8.5 billion agreement with 10 mortgage servicers to settle claims of foreclosure abuses, including bungled loan modifications and the wrongful evictions of borrowers who were either current on their payments or making reduced monthly payments.

title: Young Mets Pitchers Considered Equally Confident, but Theyre Not Two of a Kind
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  In many ways, they have seemed inextricably tied, Matt Harvey and Zack Wheeler, two right-handers expected to be at the forefront of the Mets renaissance, if one ever occurs. Together their names rest on the tips of fans tongues, quickly spoken when talk turns to a happier future for the club. At the teams spring training complex, they dress at adjacent lockers, in whispering distance of Johan Santanas.

title: Reaganism After Reagan
description: WASHINGTON

title: Assault, Battery and Government Liability
description: Kim Millbrook, an inmate in a federal prison in Pennsylvania, alleged that in 2010, he was beaten up and forced to perform oral sex on a prison guard while another guard immobilized him in a chokehold and a third stood watch. Mr. Millbrook contended that the officers said they would kill him if he told anyone about the assault and battery.

title: From the Bottom Up
description: President Obama was right about the need to increase the federal minimum wage, but it was too bad that he pulled his punches in calling on Congress to lift the wage only to $9 an hour by the end of 2015, from $7.25 an hour, where it has been since 2009.

title: When Irish Hands Are Helping an Enclave in County Queens
description: For generations the residents of Breezy Point, Queens, have clung to their emerald roots. The gated community they called the Irish Riviera  or to those who prefer the language of the Old World, cois farraige, Gaelic for beside the sea  has remained one of the most proudly Irish communities in America.

title: Rangers Take Their Time Getting a Lead, but Hold On to It
description: The Rangers beat a last-place team by a single goal at Madison Square Garden on Sunday, but it was still a victory to be proud of. They dominated practically the entire game, solved a hot goalie and had a stellar performance from Rick Nash, even though he was nursing an injury.

title: In Kabuls Car Guantnamo, Autos Languish and Trust Dies
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  On the northern edge of Kabul, down a road riddled with mammoth potholes, is a secure site that bears all the marks of a prison: high stone walls topped with concertina wire, police officers barking into walkie-talkies, forsaken visitors pacing the compounds edge, waiting for a sign of hope.

title: Voting Rights Act Is Challenged as Cure the South Has Outgrown
description: EVERGREEN, Ala.  Jerome Gray, a 74-year-old black man, has voted in every election since 1974 in this verdant little outpost of some 4,000 people halfway between Mobile and Montgomery. Casting a ballot, he said, is a way to honor the legacy of the Voting Rights Act of 1965, a civil rights landmark born from a bloody confrontation 70 miles north of here, in Selma.

title: About Those Black Sites
description: The details of American antiterrorism policies, put in place after 9/11, are still largely hidden, but more pieces of this sordid history are dribbling out.

Which Holidays Should Government Recognize?
Consumer Finance Bureau
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: President Correa Handily Wins Re-election in Ecuador
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Rafael Correa of Ecuador swept to re-election on Sunday in a vote that showed the broad popularity of his governments social programs and support for the poor in a country to which he has brought stability after years of political and economic turmoil.

title: Raise That Wage
description: President Obama laid out a number of good ideas in his State of the Union address. Unfortunately, almost all of them would require spending money  and given Republican control of the House of Representatives, its hard to imagine that happening.

title: Lottery Numbers
In Four Seasons Lobby, a Jewelry Heist in Plain Sight
description: As a crime, it may not deserve comparison to the meticulously planned hotel heists of past decades, when well-dressed robbers cleaned out safe deposit boxes of jewels and cash. Yet the sheer brazenness of two jewel thieves at the Four Seasons Hotel on Saturday set their crime apart from the run-of-the-mill hotel larceny.

title: Speaking Up, Star Becomes the Most Valuable of Players
description: HOUSTON

title: At Riviera, the Safe Play Proves a Winning Gamble
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, Calif.  From the tee box, the 10th hole at Riviera Country Club looks like another vanilla par 4 on the PGA Tour, a 315-yard test that is no match for todays generation of swashbuckling players.

title: Seeking Love When Its in Front of You
description: There are occasions when the title of Shakespeares Much Ado About Nothing seems all too apposite. Such is the unhappy case with the Theater for a New Audience production that opened on Sunday night at the Duke on 42nd Street, spreading mirth only sporadically, thanks primarily to a stylish performance by the British actor Jonathan Cake as an effervescent, audience-beguiling Benedick, a mismatched foil for the sparkle-free Beatrice of Maggie Siff.

title: When Being Jobless Is a Barrier to Finding a Job
description: The sign outside the diner said help wanted. But when Albert Mango said he was out of work, he was told there was no opening there.

title: Obama Seeking to Boost Study of Human Brain
description: The Obama administration is planning a decade-long scientific effort to examine the workings of the human brain and build a comprehensive map of its activity, seeking to do for the brain what the Human Genome Project did for genetics.

title: The Cherokees Free Their Slaves
description: Following on the heels of the Emancipation Proclamation, in February 1863 the Cherokee Nation declared that all slaves within its limits were forever free. In 1983, the descendants of these slaves, known as the Cherokee Freedmen, were removed from tribal membership rolls and prohibited from voting in Cherokee elections. A series of protracted legal battles over Freedmen citizenship ensued and continue today.

title: Catholicism Inc.
description: Behold a global business in distress  incoherently managed, resistant to the modernizing forces of the Internet age, tainted by scandal and corruption. It needs to tweak its marketing, straighten out its finances, up its recruiting game and repair its battered brand. Ecce Catholicism Inc.

title: 2 Senate Opponents Vow to End Bid to Block Hagel
description: Two of the most outspoken Republican critics of Chuck Hagels nomination as secretary of defense indicated Sunday that they would no longer hold up his Senate confirmation.

title: Chandler Savoring His First All-Star Game
description: HOUSTON  Tyson Chandler had already become one of the leagues best centers before he became an All-Star this season. He had already won an N.B.A. title with the Dallas Mavericks. He was last seasons defensive player of the year. And he won an Olympic gold medal with the United States national team last summer in London.

title: Player Overcomes Bullying and a Hiatus
description: Two years ago, at an indoor tournament in Memphis, Rebecca Marino of Canada made her first WTA final. Marino, then 20 years old, was seen as a rising star on the tour. She and her countryman Milos Raonic, who also made the Memphis final that year as a 20-year-old, inspired unprecedented optimism for Canadian tennis.

title: Tony Sheridan, Colleague of Beatles, Is Dead at 72
description: Tony Sheridan, the British guitarist, singer and songwriter who was the star on the Beatles first commercial recording  they were the backup band  died Saturday in Hamburg, Germany. He was 72.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, Feb. 18
description: It has become a huge Irish-American issue. Its another county of Ireland.

title: The Shortest and Youngest on the Court, a Girl Sparks the Boys Team
description: WHITE PLAINS  Holly Marschke sized up the opposing team moments before tipoff of a junior varsity basketball game last week. Every member of the St. Lukes team from New Canaan, Conn., was taller than every member of her team from the New York School for the Deaf-Fanwood.

title: The Next Great One?
description: Connor McDavid, a 16-year-old star in his first season in the Ontario Hockey League, is an early favorite to be selected first in the 2015 N.H.L. entry draft.

title: Software Assistants for Doctors Are Making Progress
description: Doctors have long been in the high-stakes information management business. They must quickly sort through a patients symptoms, comments, test results, records and history to come up with a diagnosis. The physician brings to each diagnostic encounter a storehouse of knowledge and experience, all that he or she has read and learned over years.

title: Certain Television Fare Can Help Ease Aggression in Young Children, Study Finds
description: Experts have long known that children imitate many of the deeds  good and bad  that they see on television. But it has rarely been shown that changing a young childs viewing habits at home can lead to improved behavior.

title: Corrections: February 18, 2013
description: NEW YORK

title: Smokings Gender Gap Closes
description: The title of a recent report on smoking and health might well have paraphrased the popular ad campaign for Virginia Slims, introduced in 1968 by Philip Morris and aimed at young professional women: Youve come a long way, baby.

title: 2 Reports on Chinese Rulers Wealth Are Among 2012 Polk Award Winners
description: Journalists who uncovered corruption at the highest levels of the Chinese government, exposed abuses at New Jerseys halfway houses and, at great personal risk, delved deep into the Syrian civil war were among the winners of 14 George Polk Awards for 2012 announced Monday by Long Island University.

title: A Prodigy on the Way to Stardom
description: ERIE, Pa.  Three hockey lifers watched Connor McDavid from worn, creaky seats at the far end of the ice. All was quiet when a crisp swoosh, the sound of a skate shredding ice, cut through the air. It sounded like paper tearing. Practice seemed to stop.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 7:30 P.M. (Cartoon Network) ADVENTURE TIME Fionna the girl (voiced by Madeleine Martin) and Cake the cat (Roz Ryan) replace Finn the boy and Jake the dog for this special gender-swapped episode. Neil Patrick Harris returns as the voice of the overly polite Prince Gumball, and Donald Glover lends his voice as Marshall Lee, a charismatic vampire who attempts to woo Fionna. On Regular Show, at 8, Mordecai and Rigby must deal with an annoying visitor.

title: Below Freezing Links
description: Statewide G.M.O.-labeling initiatives arestill going strong. Seeing the future, some of the major food companiesand Walmarthave been discussinglobbying for a national labeling program. Across the pond, Great Britains health department is backingstandardized front-of-package nutrition labels.

title: U.S. Under-20s Looking to Show Progress
description: The United States under-20 national team is set to open its World Cup qualifying tournament on Monday against Haiti in Puebla, Mexico, and the pressure is mounting on the team to reverse a recent string of unsuccessful results for American men at the youth level.

title: A Rare Defensive Stop Makes for a Highlight
description: HOUSTON  The N.B.A. All-Star game is often more about colorful sneakers and powerful dunks than one-on-one defense. When Sundays game was to be decided in the final minutes, fans were given the perfect matchup: the Los Angeles Lakers Kobe Bryant versus the Miami Heats LeBron James, two stars in the post-Michael Jordan era often compared to him.

title: Thomas Friedman Answers Your Questions
description: New York Times op-ed columnist and author Thomas L. Friedman recently wrapped up a week-long trip to India, where he met with business executives, government ministers and other officials, entrepreneurs and development groups. Even as Indias economy has slowed considerably, Mr. Friedman remains a big believer in what he calls the miracle of India.

title: Kill These Characters at Your Own Risk
description: The shocking ending of this seasons Downton Abbey  shocking at least for those who managed to avoid the news when the finale was shown in Britain in December  most likely left thousands of the shows fans mourning the loss of a beloved character and angry with the shows creators for erasing him from their lives.

title: Julian Fellowes Discusses a Season of Comings and Goings at Downton Abbey
description: These have beendark days for the Crawleys and their household staff at Downton Abbey. (And for heavens sake, dont read any further if you dont want the events of Season 3 of this PBS Masterpiece series spoiled for you. This goes double if youre Maggie Smith, in which case you should really go back and start with Season 1.)

title: Global Health Threat Seen in Overuse of Antibiotics on Chinese Pig Farms
description: BEIJING  As Europe continues to recoil at the horseburger scandal, focusing minds on the risks in long food-production chains, a new study has found that high use of antibiotics in Chinese pig farms is producing antibiotic-resistant genes that pose a potential worldwide human health risk.

title: At Mass, Texting With God
description: Dear Diary:

title: IHT Quick Read: Feb. 18
description: NEWS Millions of Chinese sacrifice heavily for their childrens education, but as college graduates saturate a slowing job market, the security they seek is increasingly elusive. Keith Bradsher reports from Hanjing, China.

title: Happy Presidents Day
description: Were taking the day off on this national holiday  and, since many schools will be out this week, were also suspending daily lesson plans until Monday, Feb. 25.

title: Russians Wade Into the Snow to Seek Treasure From the Sky
description: DEPUTATSKOYE, Russia  Ever since the meteor exploded somewhere over this impoverished Siberian town, Larisa V. Briyukova wondered what to do with the fist-size stone she found under a hole in the roof tiles of her woodshed.

title: Capital Losses
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentinas capital may be about to lose what is arguably its most iconic sight: A new project by the city government led by Mayor Mauricio Macri is turning the 9 de Julio Avenue into a shadow of itself in the name of an ill-conceived public transportation project.

title: U.N. Rights Officials Urge Syria War Crimes Charges
description: GENEVA  The United Nations Security Council should refer Syria to the International Criminal Court in The Hague to prosecute those responsible for war crimes and other abuses committed in nearly two years of conflict, Carla del Ponte, a United Nations human rights investigator, said Monday.

title: The Choice Takes a Midwinter Break
description: With at least some of our readers on a midwinter break from school, my colleagues and I are planning to take some time away from the blog.

title: Preschool Economics
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.

title: Latika Mandal, the Teacher From West Bengal
description: Why do millions of Indians, sometimes entire villages, brave the crowds to attend the Kumbh Mela? India Ink interviewed some of the estimated 100 million pilgrims who traveled to this years Kumbh Mela at Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, a 55-day pilgrimage during which Hindus take a holy dip in the Ganges River to wash away their sins.

title: Militants Attack Khyber Office in Pakistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Militants disguised as tribal police officers and wearing vests packed with explosives mounted a coordinated attack on a central office of the tribal administration in Peshawar on Monday, killing five people and wounding seven others.

title: Peter Pilotto: Fall 2013 RTW
description: London
